ny: Msewu umene ngoziyi inachitika unatsekedwa kwa kanthawi pamene mabungwe othandiza anthu pangozi anamasula dalaivala wa galimoto yofiira ya Audi TT.

en: He was initially hospitalised in the James Paget Hospital in Great Yarmouth.
ny: Poyamba anam'tengera kuchipatala cha James Paget Hospital ku Great Yarmouth.

en: He was subsequently relocated to Addenbrooke's Hospital in Cambridge.
ny: Kenako anasamutsidwira ku chipatala cha Addenbrooke ku Cambridge.

en: Adekoya has since been in Edinburgh Sheriff Court charged with murdering her son.
ny: Kuyambira pamenepo, Adekoya wakhala akuimbidwa mlandu wa kupha mwana wake.

en: She is in custody pending indictment and trial, but any eyewitness evidence may be tainted because her image has been widely published.
ny: Iye ali m'ndende poyembekezera kuimbidwa mlandu ndi kuweruzidwa, koma umboni uliwonse wa mboni zowona ndi maso ungakhale wonyansa chifukwa chakuti chithunzi chake chafalitsidwa kwambiri.

en: This is common practice elsewhere in the UK but Scottish justice works differently and courts have viewed publication of photos as potentially prejudicial.
ny: Zimenezi n'zofala m'madera ena a ku UK koma malamulo a ku Scotland amagwira ntchito mosiyana ndipo makhoti amaona kuti kufalitsa zithunzi kungakhale kovulaza.

en: Professor Pamela Ferguson of the University of Dundee notes "journalists do seem to be walking a dangerous line if publishing photos etc of suspects."
ny: Pulofesa Pamela Ferguson wa pa yunivesite ya Dundee anati "anyuzipepala amaoneka kuti akuyenda m'njira yoopsa ngati akufalitsa zithunzi ndi zina zotero za anthu amene akuwakayikira".

en: Crown Office, which is in overall charge of prosecutions, has indicated to journalists that no further comment will be made at least until indictment.
ny: Ofesi ya Crown, yomwe ili ndi udindo wozenga milandu, yanena kwa atolankhani kuti palibe ndemanga zina zomwe zidzafotokozedwe mpaka pamene mlanduwo udzafotokozedwe.

en: The document, according to the leak, will refer to the borders dispute, which Palestine wants based on the borders before the 1967 Mideast War.
ny: Malinga ndi zimene zinafalitsidwa, chikalatacho chidzafotokoza za mkangano wa malire, umene Palestina imafuna malinga ndi malire a nkhondo ya 1967 ya ku Middle East.

en: Other topics covered reportedly include the future state of Jerusalem which is sacred to both nations and the Jordan Valley issue.
ny: Nkhani zina zimene zinakambidwa zinaphatikizapo boma la Yerusalemu lomwe linali lopatulika kwa mitundu yonse iŵiri ndi nkhani ya Chigwa cha Yordano.

en: Israel demands an ongoing military presence in the valley for ten years once an agreement is signed while the PA agrees to leave such presence only for five years.
ny: Israeli ikufuna kukhalapo kwa asilikali m'chigwachi kwa zaka khumi mgwirizano ukasainidwa pamene PA ikuvomera kusiya kukhalapo kwa zaka zisanu zokha.

en: Shooters in the supplementary pest control trial were to be closely supervised by rangers, as the trial was monitored and its effectiveness evaluated.
ny: Ochita maseŵera a kuwombera m'mayesero owonjezera a kuletsa tizilombo toyambitsa matenda anafunika kuyang'aniridwa mosamalitsa ndi alonda, chifukwa chakuti mayeserowo anali kuyang'aniridwa ndi kuyesedwa kuti aone ngati anali othandiza.

en: In a partnership of NPWS and the Sporting Shooters Association of Australia (NSW) Inc, qualified volunteers were recruited, under the Sporting Shooters Association's hunting program.
ny: Pogwirizana ndi bungwe la NPWS ndi bungwe la Sporting Shooters Association of Australia (NSW) Inc, anthu odzipereka analembedwa ntchito, malinga ndi pulogalamu ya kusaka ya bungwe la Sporting Shooters Association.

en: According to Mick O'Flynn, the Acting Director Park Conservation and Heritage with the NPWS, the four shooters selected for the first shooting operation received comprehensive safety and training instruction.
ny: Malinga ndi kunena kwa Mick O'Flynn, woyang'anira ntchito ya Park Conservation and Heritage ndi NPWS, oponya mfuti anayi osankhidwa kuti aponye mfuti koyamba analandira malangizo okwanira a chitetezo ndi kuphunzitsa.

en: Martelly swore in a new Provisional Electoral Council (CEP) of nine members yesterday.
ny: Martelly analumbira dzulo m'Bungwe Latsopano la Zosankha Zosankha (CEP) la mamembala asanu ndi anayi.

en: It is Martelly's fifth CEP in four years.
ny: Ndi CEP wachisanu wa Martelly m'zaka zinayi.

en: Last month a presidential commission recommended the prior CEP's resignation as part of a package of measures to move the country towards new elections.
ny: Mwezi watha komiti ya pulezidenti inalangiza kuti CEP wakale achoke monga mbali ya ndondomeko zoyendetsera dziko ku chisankho chatsopano.

en: The commission was Martelly's response to widespread anti-regime protests that started in October.
ny: Komitiyi inali yankho la Martelly ku zionetsero zosautsa boma zomwe zinayamba mu October.

en: The sometimes-violent protests were triggered by failure to hold elections, some due since 2011.
ny: Zitsutso zomwe nthawi zina zimakhala zachiwawa zinayambitsidwa ndi kulephera kwa zisankho, zina zomwe zinali zisanachitike kuyambira 2011.

en: Around 60 cases of malfunctioning iPods overheating have been reported, causing a total of six fires and leaving four people with minor burns.
ny: Anthu pafupifupi 60 anavulala chifukwa cha kuyaka kwambiri kwa ma iPod, ndipo zimenezi zinachititsa moto pa anthu 6 ndipo anthu 4 anavulala pang'ono.

en: Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) said that it had been aware of 27 accidents related to the devices.
ny: Unduna wa Zachuma, Zamalonda ndi Makampani ku Japan (METI) unati unadziŵa za ngozi 27 zokhudzana ndi zipangizozi.

en: Last week, METI announced that Apple had informed it of 34 additional overheating incidents, which the company called "non-serious."
ny: Mlungu watha, METI inalengeza kuti Apple inamuuza za zochitika zina 34 za kutentha kwambiri, zimene kampaniyo inazitcha kuti "zosakhala zazikulu".

en: The ministry responded by calling Apple's postponement of the report "truly regrettable."
ny: Undunawo unayankha mwa kutcha kuimitsa ntchito kwa Apple kwa lipotilo kukhala "kochititsa chisoni kwambiri".

en: The eathquake struck Mariana at 07:19 a.m. local time (09:19 p.m. GMT Friday).
ny: Chivomerezichi chinachitika ku Mariana nthawi ya 07:19 m'mawa, nthawi ya m'deralo (09:19 madzulo, Lachisanu).

en: The Northern Marianas emergency management office said that there were no damages reported in the nation.
ny: Ofesi yoyang'anira zochitika zadzidzidzi ku Northern Marianas inati palibe zowonongeka zomwe zanenedwa mdzikolo.

en: Also the Pacific Tsunami Warning Center said that there was no Tsunami indication.
ny: Ndiponso Pacific Tsunami Warning Center inati panalibe chizindikiro cha Tsunami.

en: A former Filipino policeman has kept Hong Kong tourists hostage by hijacking their bus in Manila, the capital of the Philippines.
ny: Wapolisi wina wakale wa ku Philippines wasunga alendo a ku Hong Kong monga akaidi mwa kuba basi yawo ku Manila, likulu la dziko la Philippines.

en: Rolando Mendoza fired his M16 rifle at the tourists.
ny: Rolando Mendoza anawombera alendowo ndi mfuti yake ya M16.

en: Several hostages have been rescued and least six have been confirmed dead so far.
ny: Anthu angapo opulumutsidwa ndi ophedwa ndipo osachepera asanu ndi mmodzi atsimikiziridwa kuti afa mpaka pano.

en: Six hostages, including the children and elderly, were released early, as were the Filipino photographers.
ny: Anthu asanu ndi mmodzi, kuphatikizapo ana ndi okalamba, anamasulidwa mwamsanga, monganso mmene anachitira ojambula zithunzi a ku Philippines.

en: The photographers later took the place of an aged lady as she needed the lavatory. Mendoza was gunned down.
ny: Pambuyo pake ojambula zithunziwo anatenga malo a mayi wina wachikulire amene anafunikira kuchimbudzi.

en: Liggins followed in his father’s footsteps and entered a career in medicine.
ny: Liggins anatsatira mapazi a atate wake ndipo anayamba ntchito ya zamankhwala.

en: He trained as an obstetrician and began to work at the Auckland's National Women's Hospital in 1959.
ny: Anaphunzira ntchito ya kulera ana ndipo anayamba kugwira ntchito ku chipatala cha National Women's Hospital ku Auckland mu 1959.

en: While he was working at the hospital Liggins began to investigate premature labor during his spare time.
ny: Pamene anali kugwira ntchito kuchipatala, Liggins anayamba kufufuza za kubala msanga m'nthaŵi yake yopuma.

en: His research showed that if a hormone was administered it would speed up the baby's foetal lung maturation.
ny: Kafukufuku wake anasonyeza kuti ngati hormone ingapatsidwe, idzafulumizitsa kukula kwa mapapu a mwana.

en: Xinhua reported that government investigators recovered two 'black box' flight recorders on Wednesday.
ny: Xinhua inati ofufuza a boma anapeza ma 'black box' aŵiri ojambulira ndege Lachitatu.

en: Fellow wrestlers also paid tribute to Luna.
ny: Ochita maseŵera a nkhonya anasonyezanso ulemu kwa Luna.

en: Tommy Dreamer said "Luna was the first Queen of Extreme. My first manager. Luna passed away on the night of two moons. Pretty unique just like her. Strong woman."
ny: Tommy Dreamer anati "Luna anali mfumukazi yoyamba ya Extreme. Mkulu wanga woyamba. Luna anamwalira usiku wa miyezi iŵiri.

en: Dustin "Goldust" Runnels commented that "Luna was as freaky as me...maybe even more...love her and will miss her...hopefully she's in a better place."
ny: Dustin "Goldust" Runnels anafotokoza kuti "Luna anali wodabwitsa monga ine... mwinamwake ngakhale kwambiri... kumukonda ndi kumusowa... mwachiyembekezo ali m'malo abwinoko. "

en: Out of 1,400 people polled prior to the 2010 federal election, those who oppose Australia becoming a republic grew by 8 per cent since 2008.
ny: Pa anthu 1,400 amene anafunsidwa chisankho cha boma cha 2010 chisanachitike, anthu amene amatsutsa kuti Australia ikhale dziko la Republic anakwera ndi 8 peresenti kuyambira mu 2008.

en: Caretaker Prime Minister Julia Gillard claimed during the campaign of the 2010 federal election that she believed Australia should become a republic at the end of Queen Elizabeth II's reign.
ny: Pulezidenti wa boma Julia Gillard ananena pa kampeni ya chisankho cha boma cha 2010 kuti amakhulupirira kuti Australia iyenera kukhala dziko la Republic kumapeto kwa ulamuliro wa Mfumukazi Elizabeth II.

en: 34 per cent of those in the poll share this view, wanting Queen Elizabeth II to be Australia's last monarch.
ny: 34 peresenti ya anthu amene anafunsidwa maganizo ameneŵa, akufuna kuti Mfumukazi Elizabeth II akhale mfumu yomaliza ya Australia.

en: At the extremes of the poll, 29 per cent of those surveyed believe Australia should become a republic as soon as possible, while 31 per cent believe Australia should never become a republic.
ny: Pa anthu amene anafunsidwa, 29 peresenti ya anthuwo amakhulupirira kuti Australia iyenera kukhala dziko la Republic mwamsanga, pamene 31 peresenti amakhulupirira kuti Australia siyenera kukhala dziko la Republic.

en: The Olympic gold medalist was due to swim in the 100m and 200m freestyle and in three relays at the Commonwealth Games, but due to his complaints his fitness has been in doubt.
ny: Wopambana mendulo yagolide wa Olimpikiyu anayenera kusambira pa mtunda wa mamita 100 ndi 200 momasuka komanso mu maseŵera atatu a ku Commonwealth Games, koma chifukwa cha madandaulo ake, analephera kuchita bwino.

en: He has been unable to take the drugs needed to overcome his pain as they are banned from the Games.
ny: Iye sanathe kumwa mankhwala ofunika kuti athetse ululu wake chifukwa chakuti analetsedwa kuloŵa m'maseŵera.

en: Curtis Cooper, a mathematician and computer science professor at the University of Central Missouri, has discovered the largest known prime number to date on January 25.
ny: Curtis Cooper, katswiri wa masamu ndi pulofesa wa sayansi ya kompyuta pa yunivesite ya Central Missouri, anapeza nambala yoyamba yaikulu kwambiri imene inapezeka pa January 25.

en: Several people verified the discovery using different hardware and software by the beginning of February and it was announced on Tuesday.
ny: Anthu angapo anatsimikizira kuti zimenezi n'zoona pogwiritsa ntchito zipangizo zosiyanasiyana zoyendera ndi mapulogalamu pofika kumayambiriro kwa February ndipo zinalengezedwa Lachiwiri.

en: Comets may possibly have been a source of water delivery to the earth along with organic matter that can form proteins and support life.
ny: N'kutheka kuti nyenyezi za nyenyezi zinali ndi madzi ndiponso zinthu zina zimene zingathandize kuti padzikoli pakhale zamoyo.

en: Scientists hope to understand how planets form, especially how the Earth formed, since comets collided with the Earth long ago.
ny: Asayansi akuyembekeza kumvetsetsa mmene mapulaneti amapangidwira, makamaka mmene dziko lapansi linapangidwira, popeza kuti makometi anagundana ndi dziko lapansi kalekale.

en: Cuomo, 53, began his governorship earlier this year and signed a bill last month legalizing same-sex marriage.
ny: Cuomo, wazaka 53, anayamba ntchito yake monga kazembe kumayambiriro kwa chaka chino ndipo anasaina lamulo la mwezi watha lovomereza ukwati wa amuna kapena akazi okhaokha.

en: He referred to the rumors as "political chatter and silliness".
ny: Iye anatcha mphekeserazo kuti "kuyankhula kwa ndale ndi kupusa".

en: He is speculated to make a run for president in 2016.
ny: Akuganiza kuti adzapambana pa chisankho cha pulezidenti mu 2016.

en: NextGen is a system the FAA claims would allow aircraft to fly shorter routes and save millions of gallons of fuel each year and cut carbon emissions.
ny: NextGen ndi dongosolo limene FAA imanena kuti lingalole ndege kuyenda maulendo afupiafupi ndi kupulumutsa malita mamiliyoni ambiri a mafuta chaka chilichonse ndi kuchepetsa mpweya wa carbon.

en: It uses satellite-based technology as opposed to older ground-radar-based technology to allow air traffic controllers to pinpoint aircraft with greater precision and give pilots more accurate information.
ny: Imagwiritsa ntchito njira ya sayansi ya pa satellite m'malo mwa njira yakale ya radar yapadziko lapansi kuti alole olamulira ndege kuti azindikire ndege molondola kwambiri ndi kupereka kwa oyendetsa ndege chidziŵitso cholongosoka.

en: No extra transport is being put on and overground trains will not stop at Wembley, and car parking and park-and-ride facilities are unavailable at the ground.
ny: Palibe zoyendera zina zimene zikugwiritsidwa ntchito ndipo sitima zapamtunda sizidzaima pa Wembley, ndipo malo oimikapo magalimoto ndi malo oyendamo anthu sakugwiritsidwanso ntchito.

en: Fears of lack of transportation raised the possibility that the game would be forced to play behind closed doors without the team's supporters.
ny: Mantha a kusowa kwa mayendedwe anautsa kuthekera kwakuti masewerawo adzakakamizika kusewera kumbuyo kwa zitseko zotsekedwa popanda othandizira a timu.

en: A study published on Thursday in the journal Science reported on formation of a new bird species on the Ecuadorean Galápagos Islands.
ny: Kafukufuku wina amene anafalitsidwa Lachinayi m'magazini ya Science anafotokoza za kupangidwa kwa mbalame zatsopano pa zilumba za ku Ecuador za ku Galapagos.

en: Researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Sweden reported the new species evolved in just two generations, though this process had been believed to take much longer, due to breeding between an endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, and the immigrant cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.
ny: Ofufuza a pa yunivesite ya Princeton ku United States ndi pa yunivesite ya Uppsala ku Sweden ananena kuti mtundu watsopanowu unasintha m'mibadwo iŵiri yokha, ngakhale kuti anthu ankakhulupirira kuti zimenezi zinatenga nthawi yaitali, chifukwa cha kuswana pakati pa mtundu wina wa nswala yotchedwa Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, ndi mtundu wina wa nswala yotchedwa Geospiza conirostris.

en: Gold may be worked into all sorts of shapes. It can be rolled into tiny shapes.
ny: Golide akhoza kupangidwa m'njira zosiyanasiyana.

en: It can be pulled into thin wire, which can be twisted and plaited. It can be hammered or rolled into sheets.
ny: Chimakokedwa kukhala waya woonda, amene angapangidwe ndi kupindika ndi kuluka.

en: It can be made very thin, and stuck onto other metal. It can be made so thin that it was sometimes used to decorate the hand-painted pictures in books called "illuminated manuscripts".
ny: Zitha kupangidwa kukhala zoonda kwambiri, ndi kumamatira ku zitsulo zina. Zitha kupangidwa zoonda kwambiri moti nthaŵi zina zinkagwiritsidwa ntchito kukongoletsa zithunzi zojambulidwa ndi manja m'mabuku otchedwa "zolembedwa pamanja zounikira".

en: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice.
ny: Izi zimatchedwa pH ya mankhwala. Mungapange chizindikiro pogwiritsa ntchito madzi a kabichi wofiira.

en: The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is.
ny: Msuzi wa kabichi umasintha mtundu malinga ndi mmene mankhwalawo alili achikuda kapena amchere.

en: The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical.
ny: Mlingo wa pH umasonyezedwa ndi kuchuluka kwa ma hydrogen (H mu pH) mu mankhwala oyesedwa.

en: Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
ny: Ma hydrogen ion ndi ma proton omwe ali ndi ma electron awo omwe achotsedwa (popeza ma atomu a hydrogen ali ndi proton imodzi ndi electron imodzi).

en: Swirl the two dry powders together and then, with clean wet hands, squeeze them into a ball.
ny: Muzitembenuza ufa woumawo pamodzi ndiyeno, ndi manja oyera ndi onyowa, muzipukuta m'mphuno.

en: The moisture on your hands will react with the outer layers, which will feel funny and form a sort of shell.
ny: Chinyezi cha m'manja mwanu chidzagwirizana ndi zigawo zakunja, zimene zidzakhala zoseketsa ndi kupanga mtundu wa chipolopolo.

en: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system.
ny: M'mizinda ya Harappa ndi Mohenjo-daro, pafupifupi nyumba iliyonse inali ndi chimbudzi cha madzi, ndipo panali njira yapamwamba yotumizira madzi.

en: Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece.
ny: M'nyumba za mizinda ya Minoan ya ku Krete ndi Santorini ku Greece, anapeza zotsalira za zimbudzi.

en: There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.
ny: M'nthawi ya Aroma, nthawi zina malo osambiramo anali m'nyumba zosambira za anthu onse, kumene amuna ndi akazi ankakhala pamodzi.

en: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite.
ny: Mukamayitana munthu amene ali kutali kwambiri, mumagwiritsa ntchito wailesi ya m'mlengalenga.

en: The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly.
ny: Satellite imene ili m'mlengalenga imalandira uthengawo ndipo imautumiza pansi, pafupifupi nthawi yomweyo.

en: The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view.
ny: Asayansi amagwiritsa ntchito ma telesikopu m'mlengalenga chifukwa chakuti mlengalenga wa dziko lapansi umachititsa kuti kuwala ndi masomphenya athu ena azioneka molakwika.

en: It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.
ny: Pamafunika roketi lalikulu kwambiri lokhala ndi mamita oposa 100 kuti liike satana kapena telesikopu m'mlengalenga.

en: The wheel has changed the world in incredible ways. The biggest thing that the wheel has done for us is given us much easier and faster transportation.
ny: Galimoto yasintha dziko m'njira zosaneneka. Chinthu chachikulu kwambiri chimene galimotoyo yachita kwa ife ndicho kutipatsa njira zosavuta ndi zofulumira zoyendera.

en: It has brought us the train, the car, and many other transportation devices.
ny: Latipatsa sitima, galimoto, ndi zipangizo zina zambiri zoyendera.

en: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer.
ny: Pansi pawo pali amphaka a kukula kwapakati amene amadya nyama yaing'ono yaing'ono kuyambira pa akalulu mpaka ku antilope ndi njati.

en: Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds.
ny: Pomalizira pake, pali amphaka ang'onoang'ono ambiri (kuphatikizapo amphaka a ziweto) amene amadya nyama zing'onozing'ono zochuluka kwambiri monga tizilombo, nyerere, nsikidzi, ndi mbalame.

en: The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.
ny: Chinsinsi cha kupambana kwawo ndicho lingaliro la malo, ntchito yapadera imene mphaka aliyense ali nayo imene imaletsa mpikisano ndi ena.

en: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides.
ny: Mikango ndi amphaka amene amakhala ndi anthu ambiri, ndipo amakhala m'magulu akuluakulu otchedwa magulu a nkhumba.

en: Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs.
ny: Amuna okwana mmodzi kapena atatu ndi amphongo okwana makumi atatu.

en: The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters.
ny: Akazi amakhala ogwirizana kwambiri, ndipo amakhala ndi alongo ndi ana aakazi ambiri.

en: Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.
ny: Mikango ya m'nkhalangoyi imachita zinthu ngati gulu la mimbulu kapena agalu, nyama zimene zimafanana kwambiri ndi mikango (koma osati amphaka ena akuluakulu) pa khalidwe lawo, komanso zimakhala zophwanya kwambiri nyama zimene zimapha.

en: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human.
ny: Njati ndi katswiri wa maseŵera, ndipo imatha kukwera (ngakhale kuti si bwino), kusambira, kulumpha mtunda wautali, ndi kukoka ndi mphamvu zowirikiza kasanu mphamvu ya munthu wamphamvu.

en: The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar.
ny: Nkhonozi zimatha kung'ung'udza chifukwa zimatha kuitana ndi mawu a m'kamwa mwawo.

en: The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.
ny: Kuomba kwa nyalugwe sikufanana ndi kulira kwa mkango, koma kuli ngati mawu a mkokomo, ofuula.

en: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is.
ny: Mbalamezi zimakonda kudya nyama zing'onozing'ono. Zimafuna kugwira anyani, njoka, tizilombo toyambitsa matenda ndi mbalame ngati zingatheke.

en: Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground.
ny: Asayansi amakhulupirira kuti mbalamezi zimatsatira nyamazo n'kumapeza nyama zoti zidye (zodyera) poona fungo lake, n'kumasirira kumene zakhala zili.

en: They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.
ny: Amatha kuona bwino kwambiri usiku, ndipo amayenda mosamala kwambiri. Amatha kusakasaka nyama yawo mwa kusakanikirana ndi malo amene ali.

en: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before.
ny: Pamene gulu laling'ono la zamoyo (anthu ochepa) likusiyana ndi anthu omwe analipo (monga ngati anasamukira kudutsa mapiri kapena mtsinje, kapena ngati anasamukira ku chilumba chatsopano kotero kuti sangabwerere mosavuta) iwo nthawi zambiri amapezeka okha m'malo osiyana ndi momwe analiri kale.

en: This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before.
ny: Malo atsopanoŵa ali ndi zinthu zosiyanasiyana ndi ochita mpikisano osiyana, choncho anthu atsopanowo adzafunikira zinthu zina kapena kusintha kuti akhale ochita mpikisano wamphamvu kusiyana ndi mmene ankafunikira kale.

en: The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before.
ny: Anthu oyambirira sanasinthe konse, amafunikirabe kusintha mofanana ndi mmene analili kale.

en: Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population.
ny: M'kupita kwa nthaŵi, pamene anthu atsopanowo ayamba kuzoloŵera malo awo atsopano, iwo amayamba kuoneka ngati anthu ena.

en: Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species.
ny: M'kupita kwa nthaŵi, patapita zaka zikwi kapena ngakhale mamiliyoni, mitundu iŵiri ya zamoyoyo idzaoneka yosiyana kwambiri moti sitingaitche mtundu umodzi.

en: We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.
ny: Timatcha njirayi kuti kusanduka kwa mitundu, kutanthauza kuti mitundu yatsopano imapangidwa.

en: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out).
ny: Zomera zimapanga mpweya umene anthu amapuma, ndipo zimatenga mpweya wa carbon-dioxide umene anthu amapuma (kutanthauza kuti, kupuma).

en: Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade.
ny: Zomera zimapeza chakudya kuchokera ku dzuŵa mwa kupanga zinthu ndi kuwala.

en: We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.
ny: Timapanga nyumba zathu kuchokera ku zomera ndi kupanga zovala kuchokera ku zomera. Chakudya chochuluka chimene timadya ndi zomera. Popanda zomera, nyama sizingakhalepo.

en: Mosasaurus was the apex predator of its time, so it feared nothing, except other mosasaurs.
ny: Mosasaurus anali nyama yodyera yaikulu kwambiri m'nthaŵi yake, choncho sanaope chilichonse, kupatulapo mosasaurs ena.

en: Its long jaws were studded with more than 70 razor-sharp teeth, along with an extra set in the roof of its mouth, meaning that there was no escape for anything that crossed its path.
ny: Mafinya ake ataliatali anali ndi mano okwana 70 ndipo analinso ndi mano ena awiri pamwamba pa pakamwa pake. Zimenezi zikusonyeza kuti palibe chilichonse chimene chinkathawa.

en: We don't know for sure, but it may have had a forked tongue. Its diet included turtles, large fish, other mosasaurs, and it may even have been a cannibal.
ny: Sitikudziwa bwinobwino, koma n'kutheka kuti anali ndi lilime lopindika ndipo ankadya nyama zina monga nyama za mtundu wa nkhandwe, nsomba zikuluzikulu, nyama zina za mtundu wa mosasaur komanso mwina anali nyama yodyera.

en: It also attacked anything that entered the water; even a giant dinosaur such as T. rex would be no match for it.
ny: Komanso ankaukira chilichonse chimene chinkalowa m'madzi. Ngakhale nyama yaikulu kwambiri ngati T. rex, siikanatha kulimbana nayo.

en: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse
ny: Ngakhale kuti chakudya chawo chinali chodziwika kwa anthu ambiri, Aroma ankadya zakudya zachilendo monga nkhumba, nkhono, mpheta komanso tizilombo tina

en: Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals.
ny: Kusiyana kwina kunali kwakuti pamene anthu osauka ndi mkazi ankadya chakudya chawo atakhala pa mipando, amuna olemera ankakonda kuchita phwando pamodzi kumene ankagona pa mbali zawo pamene anali kudya chakudya chawo.

en: Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries.
ny: Zakudya za Aroma akale sizikanakhala ndi zakudya zimene zinabwera ku Ulaya kuchokera ku America kapena ku Asia m'zaka mazana angapo pambuyo pake.

en: For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, iwo analibe chimanga, kapena tomato, kapena mbatata, kapena kakao, ndipo panalibe Aroma akale amene anali atalawa nkhuku.

en: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god.
ny: Ababulo anamanga kachisi wamkulu wa mulungu aliyense wa milungu yawo ndipo ankaona kuti kachisiyo ndi kwawo.

en: People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals.
ny: Anthu anali kupereka nsembe kwa milungu ndipo ansembe anali kuyesa kukwaniritsa zosoŵa za milunguyo mwa kuchita miyambo ndi zikondwerero.

en: Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter.
ny: Kachisi aliyense anali ndi bwalo la kachisi lotseguka ndi malo opatulika amkati omwe ansembe okha ndi amene ankaloledwa kuloŵa.

en: Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples.
ny: Nthaŵi zina nsanja zapadera za mapiramidi, zotchedwa ziggurats, zinkamangidwa kuti zikhale mbali ya akachisi.

en: The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.
ny: Pamwamba pa nsanjayo panali malo opatulika apadera a mulungu.

en: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important.
ny: M'dziko lotentha la Middle East, nyumba sinali yofunika kwenikweni.

en: Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air.
ny: Moyo wa banja lachihebri unali kuchitika panja.

en: Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses.
ny: Akazi ankaphika m'bwalo la nyumba, ndipo masitolo anali malo ogulitsira zinthu omwe ankangotsegula.

en: There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
ny: M'dziko la Kanani munalibe nkhalango zambiri, choncho mitengo inali yodula kwambiri.

en: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland.
ny: Dziko la Greenland linali ndi anthu ochepa chabe. M'nkhani za anthu a ku Norse, amati Erik Wofiira anathamangitsidwa ku Iceland chifukwa chopha anthu, ndipo pamene anali kupita kumadzulo, anapeza dziko la Greenland n'kulipatsa dzina lakuti Greenland.

en: But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time.
ny: Koma mosasamala kanthu za zimene anapeza, mafuko a Aesikimo anali kale kukhala kumeneko panthaŵiyo.

en: Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
ny: Ngakhale kuti dziko lililonse linali 'la ku Scandinavia,' panali kusiyana kwakukulu pakati pa anthu, mafumu, miyambo ndi mbiri ya Denmark, Sweden, Norway ndi Iceland.

en: If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence.
ny: Ngati munaonera filimu yakuti National Treasure, mungaganize kuti pamapepala otchedwa Declaration of Independence panali mapu a chuma.

en: However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map.
ny: Ngakhale kuti pali mawu ena amene analembedwa kumbuyo kwa chikalatacho, sikuti ndi mapu a chuma.

en: Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words "Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down.
ny: Kumbuyo kwa chikalatachi, analembapo mawu akuti "Chipangano Choyambirira cha Kudziimira paokha cha pa July 4, 1776".

en: While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage.
ny: Ngakhale kuti palibe amene akudziŵa kuti ndi ndani amene analemba bukulo, n'zodziŵika kuti pachiyambi penipeni, bukulo linali lalikulu kwambiri (la masentimita 293⁄4 ndi masentimita 241⁄2), ndipo linakulungidwa kuti lisungidwe.

en: So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label.
ny: Choncho, n'kutheka kuti mawuwo anawonjezeredwa monga chizindikiro chabe.

en: The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free.
ny: Kufika kwa anthu pa D-Day ndi nkhondo zotsatirazi zinamasula kumpoto kwa France, koma kum'mwera sikunali kumasuka.

en: It was ruled by the "Vichy" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them.
ny: Dzikoli linali kulamulidwa ndi anthu a ku France otchedwa "Vichy", omwe anapanga pangano la mtendere ndi Ajeremani mu 1940 ndipo anagwirizana ndi adaniwo m'malo molimbana nawo.

en: On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragoon".
ny: Pa 15 August 1940, gulu la ankhondo a ku Allied linalowa kum'mwera kwa France, ndipo linatchedwa kuti "Operation Dragoon".

en: In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany.
ny: M'milungu iŵiri yokha, asilikali a ku America ndi a ku France Omasuka anamasula kum'mwera kwa France ndipo anali kupita ku Germany.

en: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society.
ny: Chikhalidwe ndicho chikhalidwe chapadera chogaŵanidwa ndi gulu lalikulu la anthu amene amakhala ndi kugwira ntchito mogwirizana, gulu.

en: The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society.
ny: Liwu lakuti chitukuko limachokera ku Chilatini civilis, kutanthauza nzika, lofanana ndi Chilatini civis, kutanthauza nzika, ndi civitas, kutanthauza mzinda kapena mzinda-boma, ndipo chimenecho chimatanthauzanso kukula kwa anthu.

en: City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination.
ny: Mzinda-boma ndiwo unayambitsa mitundu. Chikhalidwe cha chitukuko chimatanthauza kupatsirana chidziŵitso kwa mibadwo ingapo, kukhala ndi chikhalidwe chokhazikika ndi kufalitsa chilungamo.

en: Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.
ny: Nthawi zambiri zikhalidwe zazing'ono zimatha popanda kusiya umboni wofunikira wa mbiri yakale ndipo zimalephera kuzindikiridwa monga chitukuko choyenera.

en: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation.
ny: Panthawi ya nkhondo ya Chisilamu, mayiko khumi ndi atatuwo poyamba anapanga boma lofooka lapakati - ndi Congress kukhala gawo lake lokha - pansi pa Articles of Confederation.

en: Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts.
ny: Bungwe la Congress linalibe mphamvu iliyonse yoikira msonkho, ndipo, chifukwa chakuti kunalibe bungwe la boma kapena lachiweruzo, linadalira akuluakulu a boma, amene kaŵirikaŵiri sanali kugwirizana, kuti akhazikitse malamulo ake onse.

en: It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states.
ny: Ndiponso linalibe ulamuliro wochotsa malamulo a misonkho ndi mitengo ya msonkho pakati pa mayiko.

en: The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.
ny: Malamulowo anafunikira kuvomerezedwa ndi maiko onse kuti asinthe ndipo maikowo ankaona kuti boma lapakati ndi lochepa moti kaŵirikaŵiri oimira awo sankapezeka.

en: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006.
ny: Mpira wa dziko la Italy, pamodzi ndi timu ya mpira wa dziko la Germany ndi timu yachiwiri yopambana kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi ndipo anali opambana pa FIFA World Cup mu 2006.

en: Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing.
ny: Maseŵera otchuka ndi monga mpira, mpira, mpira wa volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, kupalasa njinga, ice hockey, roller hockey ndi F1 motor racing.

en: Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.
ny: Maseŵera a m'nyengo yachisanu ndi otchuka kwambiri m'madera a kumpoto, ndipo anthu a ku Italy amapikisana nawo m'maseŵera a mayiko ndi maseŵera a Olimpiki.

en: Japans holds nearly 7,000 islands (the biggest being Honshu), making Japan the 7th largest island in the world!
ny: Japan ili ndi zilumba pafupifupi 7,000 (zazikulu koposa ndi Honshu), zomwe zimapangitsa Japan kukhala chilumba chachisanu ndi chiŵiri chachikulu kwambiri padziko lonse!

en: Due to the cluster/group of islands Japan has, Japan is often referred to, on a geographical stance, as an "archipelago"
ny: Chifukwa cha gulu la zilumba zimene Japan ili nazo, Japan amatchedwa kuti "zilumba"

en: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island.
ny: Chigawo cha Taiwan chinayamba m'zaka za zana la 15 pamene oyendetsa sitima a ku Ulaya amene anali kudutsa m'derali analemba dzina la chilumbachi kuti Ilha Formosa, kapena kuti chilumba chokongola.

en: In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations.
ny: Mu 1624, kampani ya Dutch East India inakhazikitsa malo ku Southwestern Taiwan, kuyambitsa kusintha kwa njira zopangira tirigu za anthu a ku Aboriginal ndi kugwiritsira ntchito antchito achi China kugwira ntchito m'minda yake ya mpunga ndi shuga.

en: In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885.
ny: Mu 1683, asilikali a ufumu wa Qing (1644-1912) anagonjetsa madera akumadzulo ndi kumpoto kwa nyanja ya Taiwan ndipo analengeza kuti Taiwan ndi chigawo cha Ufumu wa Qing mu 1885.

en: In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.
ny: Mu 1895, boma la Qing litagonjetsedwa pa nkhondo yoyamba ya ku China ndi Japan (1894-1895), linasaina Pangano la Shimonoseki, limene linapereka ulamuliro wa Taiwan kwa Japan, amene analamulira chilumbachi mpaka mu 1945.

en: Machu Picchu consist of three main structures, namely Intihuatana, the Temple of the Sun, and the Room of the Three Windows.
ny: Machu Picchu ali ndi nyumba zitatu zikuluzikulu, zomwe ndi Intihuatana, Kachisi wa Dzuŵa, ndi Chipinda cha Mawindo Atatu.

en: Most of the buildings on the edges of the complex have been rebuilt in order to give tourists a better idea of how they originally appeared.
ny: Nyumba zambiri za m'mphepete mwa nyumbayi zinamangidwanso kuti alendo aziona bwino mmene zinalili poyamba.

en: By 1976, thirty percent of Machu Picchu had been restored and restoration continues till today.
ny: Pofika mu 1976, 30 peresenti ya Machu Picchu inali itakonzedwanso ndipo ntchitoyi ikupitirirabe mpaka lero.

en: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, mtundu wofala kwambiri wojambula zithunzi padziko lonse lapansi ndi 35mm, yomwe inali kukula kwa filimu kumapeto kwa nthawi ya kanema wa analog.

en: It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats.
ny: Masiku ano, imagulitsidwabe, koma chofunika kwambiri n'chakuti, maonekedwe ake analowa m'malo mwa makina ojambula zithunzi a makamera a digito.

en: The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height.
ny: Mtundu wa 35mm ulidi, wosokoneza pang'ono, 36mm m'lifupi ndi 24mm m'mwamba.

en: The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2.
ny: Choncho, chiwerengero cha mbali za mtundu umenewu (kugawa ndi khumi ndi aŵiri kuti tipeze chiŵerengero chophweka kwambiri) chimatchedwa kuti 3:2.

en: Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.
ny: Mawonekedwe ambiri (APS banja la maonekedwe, mwachitsanzo) ali ofanana kapena pafupi kwambiri ndi chiŵerengero ichi.

en: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image.
ny: Lamulo la magawo atatu lomwe limagwiritsidwa ntchito molakwa ndiponso kusekedwa kaŵirikaŵiri ndi lamulo losavuta limene limachititsa kuti zinthu ziziyenda bwino pamene likupitirizabe kukhala ndi dongosolo m'chithunzicho.

en: It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).
ny: Limanena kuti malo abwino kwambiri a chinthu chachikulu ndi pamene mizere imagawanikana, ndipo imagawanitsa chithunzicho kukhala magawo atatu, m'mbali mwa mzere ndi m'mbali mwa mzere (onani chitsanzo).

en: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny.
ny: Panthaŵi imeneyi m'mbiri ya ku Ulaya, Tchalitchi cha Katolika, chomwe chinali chitakhala cholemera ndi champhamvu, chinayesedwa.

en: For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I
ny: Kwa zaka zoposa chikwi, chipembedzo chachikristu chinali chikugwirizanitsa mayiko a ku Ulaya mosasamala kanthu za kusiyana kwa zinenero ndi miyambo.

en: Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner.
ny: Mphamvu yake yofalikira inali kukhudza aliyense kuyambira mfumu mpaka munthu wamba.

en: One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason.
ny: Chimodzi mwa ziphunzitso zazikulu zachikristu nchakuti chuma chiyenera kugwiritsiridwa ntchito kuchepetsa kuvutika ndi umphaŵi ndi kuti ndalama za tchalitchi zilipo makamaka kaamba ka chifukwa chimenecho.

en: The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.
ny: Ulamuliro waukulu wa tchalitchi unali ku Roma kwa zaka zoposa chikwi chimodzi ndipo kugwirizana kwa mphamvu ndi ndalama kumeneku kunapangitsa ambiri kukayikira ngati chiphunzitso chimenechi chinali kukwaniritsidwa.

en: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany.
ny: Pasanapite nthaŵi yaitali nkhondo itangoyamba, dziko la Britain linayamba kuzungulira dziko la Germany.

en: The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries.
ny: Njira imeneyi inachita bwino kwambiri, ndipo inachititsa kuti asilikali ndi anthu wamba asamasamuke, ngakhale kuti njira imeneyi inaphwanya malamulo a mayiko amene anthu ambiri amavomereza, omwe analembedwa m'malamulo osiyanasiyana a mayiko m'zaka 200 zapitazi.

en: Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships.
ny: Britain inagwetsa mabomba m'madzi apadziko lonse kuti sitima zisamaloŵe m'madera onse a m'nyanja, ndipo izi zinachititsa kuti ngakhale sitima zosafuna kuloŵerera m'zinthu zina zisawonongeke.

en: Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.
ny: Popeza kuti panali yankho lochepa pa njira imeneyi, Germany inkayembekezera yankho lofanana ndi ilo pa nkhondo yake yopanda malire ya sitima zapamadzi.

en: During the 1920s, the prevailing attitudes of most citizens and nations was that of pacifism and isolation.
ny: M'zaka za m'ma 1920, anthu ambiri anali ndi maganizo ofuna kukhala chete ndiponso odzitchinjiriza.

en: After seeing the horrors and atrocities of war during World War I, nations desired to avoid such a situation again in the future.
ny: Pambuyo poona zoopsa ndi nkhanza za nkhondo mkati mwa Nkhondo Yadziko I, mitundu inalakalaka kupeŵa mkhalidwe wotero m'tsogolo.

en: In 1884, Tesla moved to the United States of America to accept a job with the Edison Company in New York City.
ny: Mu 1884, Tesla anasamukira ku United States of America kuti akapeze ntchito ku Edison Company ku New York City.

en: He arrived in the US with 4 cents to his name, a book of poetry, and a letter of recommendation from Charles Batchelor (his manager in his previous job) to Thomas Edison.
ny: Anafika ku United States ndi ndalama zokwana masenti 4, buku la ndakatulo, ndi kalata yoyamikira imene Charles Batchelor (mtsogoleri wake pa ntchito yake yapitayi) analembera Thomas Edison.

en: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty.
ny: China wakale anali ndi njira yapadera yosonyezera nyengo zosiyanasiyana; gawo lililonse la China kapena banja lililonse lomwe linali ndi mphamvu linali ufumu wapadera.

en: Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty.
ny: Pakati pa mafumu onsewo panali nyengo yosakhazikika ya zigawo zogawanika. Nthaŵi yodziŵika kwambiri pa nyengo zimenezi inali nyengo ya Maufumu Atatu imene inachitika kwa zaka 60 pakati pa mafumu a Han ndi Jin.

en: During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne.
ny: M'nthaŵi zimenezi, panali nkhondo zankhanza pakati pa anthu ambiri olemekezeka amene anali kumenyana kuti akhale pa mpando wachifumu.

en: The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.
ny: Maufumu Atatu anali imodzi mwa nyengo zophetsa mwazi kwambiri m'mbiri ya China Wakale. Anthu zikwizikwi anafa akumenya nkhondo kuti akhale pampando wapamwamba kwambiri m'nyumba yachifumu yaikulu ya Xi'an.

en: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler.
ny: Pali zotsatira zambiri za chikhalidwe ndi ndale monga kugwiritsira ntchito dongosolo la mita, kusintha kuchokera ku ulamuliro wosapondereza kupita ku boma, mtundu ndi chikhulupiriro chakuti dziko liri la anthu osati kwa wolamulira mmodzi yekha.

en: Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed.
ny: Ndiponso pambuyo pa Revolution ntchito zinatsegulidwa kwa ofunsira onse aamuna kulola anthu ofuna kwambiri ndi opambana kwambiri kuti apambane.

en: Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber.
ny: Chimodzimodzinso ndi asilikali chifukwa m'malo moika asilikali m'magulu a anthu, tsopano anali kuika asilikali m'magulu a anthu.

en: The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.
ny: Kusintha kwa dziko la France kunalimbikitsanso anthu ambiri a m'magulu a antchito oponderezedwa a m'maiko ena kuyamba kusintha kwawo.

en: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation.
ny: Muhammad anali ndi chidwi kwambiri ndi zinthu zina za moyo wa dziko lapansi. Ankakonda kupita kuphanga lomwe linadziwika kuti Hira pa Phiri la Noor (kuwala) kuti akaganize.

en: he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations.
ny: Phanga lenilenilo, limene linapulumuka nthaŵiyo, limapereka chithunzi chenicheni cha zikhoterero zauzimu za Muhammad.

en: Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world.
ny: M'phanga limeneli muli phiri lina kumpoto kwa mzinda wa Mecca ndipo lili kutali ndi dziko lonse.

en: In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation.
ny: Ndipotu, n'zovuta kupeza ngakhale munthu atadziwa kuti kulipo.

en: Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
ny: Palibe chimene chingaoneke kupatulapo thambo lowala ndi lokongola lomwe lili pamwamba pake ndi mapiri ambiri ozungulira.

en: The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today.
ny: Piramidi Yaikulu ya ku Giza ndiyo yokha mwa zodabwitsa zisanu ndi ziŵiri zimene zidakalipo lerolino.

en: Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh.
ny: Inamangidwa ndi Aigupto m'zaka za zana lachitatu B.C.E., Pyramid Yaikulu ndi imodzi mwa nyumba zazikulu za piramidi zomangidwa polemekeza Farao wakufa.

en: The Giza Plateau, or "Giza Necropolis" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx.
ny: M'mphepete mwa nyanja ya Giza, kapena kuti "Giza Necropolis" m'chigwa cha ku Igupto cha akufa, muli mapiramidi angapo (omwe piramidi yaikulu ndiyo yaikulu kwambiri), manda ang'onoang'ono angapo, akachisi angapo, ndi Sphinx wamkulu.

en: The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members.
ny: Piramidi yaikulu inamangidwa polemekeza Farao Khufu, ndipo mapiramidi ang'onoang'ono, manda, ndi akachisi ambiri anamangidwa polemekeza akazi a Khufu ndi anthu a m'banja lake.

en: The "up bow" mark looks like a V and the "down bow mark" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side.
ny: Chizindikiro cha "m'mwamba" chikuoneka ngati V ndipo "m'munsi" chikuoneka ngati chikhomo kapena malo osakhala ndi mbali ya pansi.

en: Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow.
ny: Kumwamba kumatanthauza kuti muyenera kuyamba pa nsonga ndi kukankhira uta, ndipo pansi kumatanthauza kuti muyenera kuyamba pa mbewa (yomwe ndi pamene dzanja lanu likugwira uta) ndi kukoka uta.

en: An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive.
ny: Nthawi zambiri, mawu a m'mphepete mwa phiko amakhala ofewa, pamene a m'munsi mwa phiko amakhala amphamvu kwambiri ndiponso osonyeza kuti munthu ndi wolimba mtima.

en: Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected.
ny: Khalani omasuka kulemba zizindikiro zanu, koma kumbukirani kuti zizindikiro za kupembedza zimene zasindikizidwa zilipo chifukwa cha nyimbo, chotero kaŵirikaŵiri ziyenera kulemekezedwa.

en: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women.
ny: Mfumu Louis XVI, Mfumukazi Marie Antoinette, ana awo aŵiri aang'ono (a Marie Therese wa zaka 11 ndi a Louis-Charles wa zaka zinayi) ndi mlongo wa mfumu, Madame Elizabeth, anaopsezedwa ndi gulu la akazi a msika kuti abwerere ku Paris kuchokera ku Versailles pa 6 October 1789.

en: In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen.
ny: M'galimoto, iwo anabwerera ku Paris atazunguliridwa ndi gulu la anthu amene anali kufuula ndi kuwopseza Mfumu ndi Mfumukazi.

en: The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open.
ny: Khamu la anthu linakakamiza Mfumu ndi Mfumukazi kuti zitseko za magalimoto awo zizitsegulidwa.

en: At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.
ny: Panthaŵi ina, mmodzi wa gulu la anthuwo anawomba mutu wa msilikali wa mfumu amene anaphedwa ku Versailles pamaso pa mfumukazi yochita mantha.

en: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves.
ny: Ndalama zimene boma la U.S. linagwiritsa ntchito pa nkhondo pogonjetsa Philippines zinaperekedwa ndi anthu a ku Philippines omwe.

en: They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses.
ny: Iwo anakakamizika kulipira misonkho ku boma la atsamunda la United States kuti lipereke mbali yaikulu ya ndalamazo ndi chiwongola dzanja cha ngongole za boma la Philippines kudzera m'mabanki a Wall Street.

en: Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.
ny: Ndithudi, phindu lalikulu limene linatuluka m'kuzunza kwa nthaŵi yaitali kwa anthu a ku Philippines linali kudzakhala phindu lalikulu la ulamuliro wa U.S.

en: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order.
ny: Kuti timvetse za Atempulo tiyenera kumvetsa nkhani imene inachititsa kuti gululi likhazikitsidwe.

en: The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300).
ny: Nthawi imene zochitikazo zinachitika imatchedwa kuti High Middle Ages, yomwe ndi nthawi ya mbiri ya ku Ulaya m'zaka za m'ma 1100, 12 ndi 13 (AD 10001300).

en: The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.
ny: Zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka zapakati pa zaka za 1500 ndi 1500.

en: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology.
ny: Kukhazikitsa matekinoloje ndi mawu amene akuphatikiza malingaliro osiyanasiyana m'zochita, kuchokera pa kukakamiza kwa matekinoloje kapena kufunikira kwa matekinoloje mpaka kumverera koyenera kuti tsogolo la munthu limayendetsedwa ndi malingaliro ofanana ndi malamulo a sayansi ndi maonekedwe awo mu teknoloji.

en: Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has "effects" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned.
ny: Malongosoledwe ambiri a sayansi ya sayansi amagawana malingaliro awiri: kuti chitukuko cha sayansi chimatsatira njira yoposa chikhalidwe kapena ndale, ndipo kuti luso lamakono limakhala ndi "zotsatira" pa magulu omwe ali nawo, osati chikhalidwe.

en: For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, wina anganene kuti galimoto mosakayikira imachititsa kuti misewu ikhale yabwino.

en: However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership.
ny: Komabe, misewu ya m'dziko lonse si yofunika kwambiri kuti magalimoto ochepa okha apange galimoto, choncho njira zatsopano zopangira magalimoto zimapangidwa kuti ndalama zogulira magalimoto zichepe.

en: Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies.
ny: Kugwiritsa ntchito magalimoto ambiri kumachititsanso kuti anthu azichita ngozi zambiri pamsewu, ndipo zimenezi zimachititsa kuti pakhale njira zatsopano zothandizira anthu amene avulala.

en: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel.
ny: Chikondi cha anthu chinali ndi mbali yaikulu ya chikhalidwe cha anthu, chochokera kwa olemba monga Goethe, Fichte, ndi Schlegel.

en: In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.
ny: M'nthaŵi ya Chikondi, malo ndi malo anali kupanga anthu, ndipo m'kupita kwa nthaŵi miyambo ndi chikhalidwe zokhudzana ndi malo amenewo zinayamba, ndipo zimenezi, zikugwirizana ndi malo a anthu, zinali zabwino kuposa malamulo opangidwa mwaufulu.

en: In the manner that Paris is known as the fashion capital of the contemporary world, Constantinople was regarded as the fashion capital of feudal Europe.
ny: Monga mmene Paris amadziŵikira monga likulu la mafashoni m'dziko lamakono, Constantinople ankaonedwa monga likulu la mafashoni la ku Ulaya.

en: Its renown for being an epicenter of luxury began in about 400 A.D. and lasted up until about 1100 A.D.
ny: Dzina lake loti linali likulu la zinthu zapamwamba linayamba cha m'ma 400 C.E. ndipo linapitirira mpaka cha m'ma 1100 C.E.

en: Its status declined during the twelfth century mainly due to the fact that Crusaders had returned bearing gifts such as silks and spices that were valued more than what Byzantine markets offered.
ny: Mkhalidwe wake unatsika m'zaka za zana la khumi ndi chiŵiri makamaka chifukwa chakuti Asilikali a Mtanda anabwerera ndi mphatso monga silika ndi zonunkhira zimene zinali zamtengo wapatali kuposa zimene misika ya Byzantine inapereka.

en: It was at this time that the transfer of the title of Fashion Capital from Constantinople to Paris was made.
ny: Panthaŵi imeneyi, dzina lakuti Fashion Capital linasamutsidwa kuchoka ku Constantinople kupita ku Paris.

en: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century.
ny: Mtundu wa Gothic unakula kwambiri pakati pa zaka za m'ma 10 ndi 11 ndi zaka za m'ma 14.

en: At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east.
ny: Poyamba, kavalidwe kanali kotengeka kwambiri ndi chikhalidwe cha ku Byzantine chakum'mawa.

en: However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year.
ny: Komabe, chifukwa cha njira zochepetsera kulankhulana, masitayilo a kumadzulo angakhale kumbuyo ndi zaka 25 mpaka 30.

en: towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.
ny: Kumapeto kwa zaka za m'ma 500 mpaka m'ma 1500, anthu a kumadzulo kwa Ulaya anayamba kupanga zovala zawo. Chimodzi mwa zinthu zazikulu kwambiri zimene zinachitika pa nthawiyo chinali chakuti anthu anayamba kugwiritsa ntchito mabatani kuti azisunga zovala.

en: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family.
ny: Ulimi wokhalitsa ndi ulimi umene umachitika kuti apange chakudya chokwanira kukwaniritsa zosoŵa za alimi ndi banja lawo.

en: Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield.
ny: Ulimi wokhalitsa ndi njira yosavuta, kaŵirikaŵiri yokhala ndi zinthu zamoyo, yogwiritsira ntchito mbewu zosungidwa za m'dera la zachilengedwe pamodzi ndi kusinthasintha mbewu kapena njira zina zosavuta kuti apindule kwambiri.

en: Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.
ny: M'mbuyomu alimi ambiri anali kuchita ulimi wopezera zosowa zawo ndipo zimenezi zikadali choncho m'maiko ambiri amene akutukuka kumene.

en: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity.
ny: Zikhalidwe za anthu zimagwirizanitsa anthu amene ali ndi maganizo ofanana ndi awo amene amadziona kuti ndi osanyalanyazidwa ndi chikhalidwe cha anthu ndipo zimawathandiza kukhala ndi maganizo ofanana ndi awo.

en: Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members.
ny: Zikhalidwe zingakhale zosiyana chifukwa cha msinkhu, fuko, kalasi, malo, ndi/kapena kugonana kwa mamembala.

en: The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors.
ny: Makhalidwe amene amachititsa kuti chikhalidwe chinachake chikhale chosiyana ndi zinazake angakhale zinenero, kukongola, chipembedzo, ndale, kugonana, malo, kapena zinthu zina.

en: Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.
ny: Anthu a m'chikhalidwe chinachake nthaŵi zambiri amasonyeza kuti ali m'gulu lachikhalidwecho mwa kugwiritsa ntchito kalembedwe kapadera ndi kophiphiritsa, komwe kumaphatikizapo mafashoni, kachitidwe ka zinthu, ndi mawu osonyeza kusamveka bwino.

en: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up.
ny: Njira imodzi imene anthu ambiri amagwiritsa ntchito posonyeza kufunika kwa kucheza ndi anthu ena ndiyo kugwiritsa ntchito nkhani zosaiŵalika za ana amene, chifukwa cha kunyalanyazidwa, kusokonekera, kapena kuzunzidwa mwadala, anawo sanakhale ndi anthu akuluakulu pamene anali kukula.

en: Such children are called "feral" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment.
ny: Ana oterewa amatchedwa "achilengedwe" kapena achilengedwe. Ana ena achilengedwe akhala akuikidwa m'ndende ndi anthu (nthawi zambiri makolo awo); nthawi zina anawo anasiyidwa chifukwa chakuti makolowo anakana kuti mwana wawo ali ndi vuto lalikulu la maganizo kapena thupi.

en: Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away.
ny: Ana amene amazunzidwa kwambiri kapena amene amavutika maganizo kwambiri asanawataye kapena kuthawa.

en: Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own.
ny: Ena amati analeredwa ndi zinyama; ena amati anakhala m'tchire paokha.

en: When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans.
ny: Pamene akuleredwa ndi nyama zosaoneka ngati anthu, mwana wakuthengo amasonyeza khalidwe (m'kati mwa malire a thupi) pafupifupi mofanana ndi la nyama yosamaliridwayo, monga kuopa anthu kapena kusasamala anthu.

en: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond.
ny: Ngakhale kuti kuphunzira pogwiritsa ntchito polojekiti kuyenera kupangitsa kuphunzira kukhala kosavuta ndiponso kosangalatsa, kupanga masitepe kumapitirira pamenepo.

en: Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project.
ny: Kuika masitepe si njira yophunzirira koma ndi chithandizo chomwe chimathandiza anthu omwe akuphunzira zatsopano monga kugwiritsa ntchito pulogalamu yatsopano ya kompyuta kapena kuyamba ntchito yatsopano.

en: Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office.
ny: Makwerero angakhale enieni ndi enieni, m'mawu ena, mphunzitsi ndi mtundu wa makwerero koma ndi mmenenso alili munthu wamng'ono wa m'malata mu Microsoft Office.

en: Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.
ny: Ma Virtual Scaffolds amaikidwa m'mapulogalamu ndipo cholinga chake ndi kufunsa mafunso, kufunsa, ndi kufotokoza njira zimene zingakhale zovuta kuti wophunzira azigwiritsa ntchito yekha.

en: Children are placed in Foster Care for a wide variety of reasons that range from neglect, to abuse, and even to extortion.
ny: Ana amaikidwa m'nyumba zosungirako ana chifukwa cha zifukwa zosiyanasiyana, kuyambira kusamalidwa, kuzunzidwa, ngakhalenso kupatsidwa ndalama.

en: No child should ever have to grow up in an environment that is not nurturing, caring, and educational, but they do.
ny: Palibe mwana amene ayenera kukula m'malo amene anthu sam'samalira, samamusamalira, ndiponso sam'phunzitsa, koma ana amakula.

en: We perceive the Foster Care System to be a safety zone for these children.
ny: Timaona kuti ana amene ali m'mabanja osungirako ana ndi otetezeka.

en: Our foster care system is supposed to provide safe homes, loving caregivers, stable education, and reliable health care.
ny: Makolo amene amalola ana awo kuti azisamaliridwa ndi anthu ena, amafunika kukhala ndi nyumba zabwino, anthu achikondi, maphunziro abwino ndiponso chithandizo cha mankhwala chodalirika.

en: Foster care is supposed to provide all the necessities that were lacking in the home they were previously taken from.
ny: Kusamalira ana oleredwa ndi makolo awo kumayenera kupereka zinthu zonse zofunika zimene zinali kusowa m'nyumba imene anawatenga.

en: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication.
ny: Intaneti imaphatikiza zinthu za kulankhulana kwa anthu ambiri ndi anthu ena.

en: The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach.
ny: Makhalidwe osiyana a intaneti amachititsa kuti pakhale zina zowonjezera pazochita ndi zokondweretsa.

en: For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995).
ny: Mwachitsanzo, kuphunzira ndi kucheza akunenedwa kuti ndi zifukwa zofunika zogwiritsira ntchito Intaneti (James et al., 1995).

en: “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.
ny: Kukhudzidwa ndi munthu payekha ndi kukhala ndi ubale zinatchulidwanso monga mbali zatsopano za chilimbikitso ndi Eighmey ndi McCord (1998) pamene anafufuza mayankho a omvetsera pa mawebusaiti.

en: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds.
ny: Kugwiritsa ntchito mavidiyo kwachititsa kuti anthu apeze zinthu zofunika kwambiri zokhudza mmene angamasulire mawu a m'maso, omwe ndi mayendedwe a nkhope omwe amakhalapo kwa milisekondi zochepa chabe.

en: In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly.
ny: Makamaka, amati munthu angathe kuzindikira ngati munthu akunama mwa kumasulira bwino mawu a m'maganizo.

en: Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately.
ny: Oliver Sacks, m'nkhani yake yakuti The President's Speech, anasonyeza mmene anthu amene sangathe kumvetsetsa kulankhula chifukwa cha kuwonongeka kwa ubongo amachitirabe bwino poona ngati munthuyo alidi woona mtima.

en: He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
ny: Iye akuti ngakhale nyama monga agalu a m'nyumba, zingakhale ndi luso lotha kumvetsa khalidwe la anthu.

en: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed.
ny: Kafukufuku wa m'zaka za zana la 20 wasonyeza kuti pali mitundu iŵiri ya kusinthasintha kwa majini: kobisika ndi kowonetsedwa.

en: Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation.
ny: Kusintha kwa maselo kumawonjezera kusintha kwatsopano kwa majini, ndipo kusankha kumachotsa m'maselo osinthika.

en: Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.
ny: Kupatula ndi kusakanikirana kumasintha kusinthasintha kwa magulu aŵiriwo ndi m'badwo uliwonse.

en: Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources.
ny: Kumtunda kwa dziko la savanna, nkovuta kuti nyama yaing'ono yokhala ndi dongosolo la m'mimba ngati la anthu ikwaniritse zosoŵa zake za amino asidi kuchokera ku zomera zomwe zilipo.

en: Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death.
ny: Ndiponso, kulephera kuchita zimenezo kumakhala ndi zotulukapo zoipa: kupsinjika kwa kukula, kusowa zakudya m'thupi, ndipo pamapeto pake imfa.

en: The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked.
ny: Zomera zimene zimapezeka mosavuta ndi mapuloteni amene amapezeka m'masamba ndi m'nthanga, koma nyama zimenezi zimapweteketsa kwambiri nyama za m'gulu la nyama zoyamba kukhala ngati ifeyo ngati sitikuziphika.

en: In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids.
ny: Koma zakudya za nyama (nthunzi, mileme, mazira) sizimangokhala zosavuta kugaya, koma zimaperekanso mapuloteni ambiri okhala ndi amino acid onse ofunika.

en: All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their "protein problem" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today.
ny: Zonsezi zikaganiziridwa, sitiyenera kudabwa ngati makolo athu anathetsa "vuto la mapuloteni" mwa njira yofanana ndi imene amphaka a m'savannah amathetsera lerolino.

en: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes).
ny: Kusokoneza tulo ndi njira imene munthu amagwiritsa ntchito podzuka ndi kugona patapita mphindi zochepa (10-60).

en: This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you.
ny: Zimenezi zingachitike mosavuta mwa kugwiritsa ntchito wotchi ya m'manja yopanda phokoso kuti ikubweretseni ku chidziŵitso popanda kukudzutsani kotheratu.

en: If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off.
ny: Ngati mutagona n'kuyambanso kuika mawotchi, akhoza kuikidwa mbali ina ya chipindacho, n'kukukakamizani kuti mutuluke pabedi kuti muzimitse mawotchiwo.

en: Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
ny: Njira zina zoyendetsera kayendedwe ka thupi zimaphatikizapo kumwa madzi ambiri (makamaka madzi kapena tiyi, mankhwala odziŵika kuti amathandiza munthu kuti asagone), kukakamiza munthu kuti anyamuke kukodza.

en: The amount of inner peace a person possesses correlates oppositely to the amount of tension in one’s body and spirit.
ny: Mtendere wa mumtima umene munthu amakhala nawo umakhala wofanana ndi mmene thupi ndi mzimu wake zimakhalira.

en: The lower the tension, the more positive the life force present. Every person has the potential to find absolute peace and contentment.
ny: Munthu aliyense ali ndi mwayi wopeza mtendere weniweni ndi kukhutira.

en: Everyone can achieve enlightenment. The only thing standing in the way of this goal is our own tension and negativity.
ny: Aliyense angathe kufika pa chidziŵitso. Chinthu chokha chimene chimatitsekereza pa cholinga chimenechi ndicho kupsinjika kwathu ndi kusalungama.

en: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga.
ny: Chibuda cha ku Tibet chimachokera ku ziphunzitso za Buddha, koma chinakulitsidwa ndi njira ya chikondi ya Mahayana ndi njira zambiri za Yoga ya ku India.

en: In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love.
ny: Mfundo zake n'zosavuta kwambiri, ndipo zimaphatikizapo Kundalini Yoga, kusinkhasinkha, ndi njira ya chikondi chophatikizapo zonse.

en: With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations.
ny: Ndi Kundalini Yoga mphamvu ya Kundalini (mphamvu ya chidziŵitso) imauka kupyolera m'machitidwe a yoga, zolimbitsa kupuma, mantras ndi masomphenya.

en: The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.
ny: Malo a kusinkhasinkha kwa Chibeti ndi Deity Yoga. Kupyolera mu kulingalira kwa milungu yosiyanasiyana njira zamagetsi zimayeretsedwa, chakras zimayendetsedwa ndipo chidziwitso cha chidziwitso chimapangidwa.

en: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out.
ny: Germany anali mdani wamba mu Nkhondo Yadziko II, zomwe zinachititsa mgwirizano pakati USSR ndi USA. ndi mapeto a nkhondo mikangano ya dongosolo, ndondomeko ndi chikhalidwe zinachititsa mayiko kugwa.

en: With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began.
ny: Patatha zaka ziŵiri nkhondo itatha, anzathu akale tsopano anali adani ndipo nkhondo yozizira inayamba.

en: It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
ny: Unali kudzatha zaka 40 zotsatira ndipo ukamenyana kwenikweni, ndi magulu ankhondo othandizira, pa nkhondo zochokera ku Africa mpaka ku Asia, ku Afghanistan, ku Cuba ndi malo ena ambiri.

en: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead.
ny: Pofika pa September 17, 1939, chitetezo cha ku Poland chinali chitaphwanyidwa kale, ndipo chiyembekezo chokha chinali chakuti achoke ndi kukonzanso zinthu m'mbali mwa mlatho wa ku Romania.

en: However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.
ny: Komabe, mapulani ameneŵa anasiya kugwira ntchito pafupifupi usiku umodzi, pamene asilikali oposa 800,000 a Soviet Union's Red Army analowa ndi kupanga maofesi a ku Belarus ndi Ukraine ataukira madera a kum'mawa kwa Poland, kuphwanya Pangano la Mtendere la ku Riga, Pangano la Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression, ndi mapangano ena apadziko lonse, onse aŵiri ndi aŵiri.

en: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans.
ny: Kugwiritsa ntchito sitima zonyamula katundu ndiyo njira yabwino kwambiri yosamutsira anthu ndi katundu wambiri kudutsa nyanja.

en: The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods.
ny: Ntchito ya asilikali a m'madzi nthaŵi zonse yakhala yotsimikizira kuti dziko lanu likhoza kusuntha anthu ndi katundu wanu, pamene panthaŵi imodzimodziyo, likusokoneza mphamvu ya mdani wanu yosuntha anthu ndi katundu wake.

en: One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain.
ny: Chimodzi mwa zitsanzo zochititsa chidwi kwambiri za zimenezi chinali nkhondo ya ku North Atlantic ya nkhondo yachiŵiri ya padziko lonse.

en: At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic.
