ny: Panthaŵi imodzimodziyo, asilikali a nkhondo a ku Germany, makamaka pogwiritsa ntchito sitima za m'madzi za U-boat, anali kuyesa kuletsa kayendedwe kameneka.

en: Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.
ny: Ngati mayiko a Mgwirizano akanalephera, mwina Germany ikanatha kugonjetsa Britain monga momwe inagonjetsera dziko lonse la Ulaya.

en: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran.
ny: Zikuoneka kuti mbuzi zinayamba kuleredwa zaka pafupifupi 10,000 zapitazo m'mapiri a Zagros ku Iran.

en: Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins.
ny: Anthu akale anayamba kuzisunga kuti azitha kupeza mkaka, tsitsi, nyama ndi zikopa.

en: Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.
ny: Nthawi zambiri abusa ankaweta mbuzi m'magulu a nkhosa amene ankayenda m'mapiri kapena m'madera ena, ndipo abusawo ankakhala ana kapena achinyamata.

en: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century.
ny: M'zaka za m'ma 1500 anthu anayamba kumanga magalimoto ku England.

en: Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day.
ny: Ngakhale kuti misewu ya magalimoto inali yokhala ndi matabwa omwe anali m'mbali mwake, ankathandiza kuti mahatchi amene anali kukoka magalimotowo azithamanga kwambiri komanso kukoka katundu wambiri kusiyana ndi misewu youma kwambiri imene inalipo pa nthawiyo.

en: Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top.
ny: Komabe, pang'onopang'ono anthu anazindikira kuti njanjizo zikhoza kugwira ntchito bwino ngati zili ndi chitsulo pamwamba pake.

en: This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons.
ny: Zimenezi zinakhala chizoloŵezi chofala, koma chitsulocho chinapangitsa mawilo a matabwa a ngolozo kuvala kwambiri.

en: Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
ny: Kenako, mu 1767, njanji zoyambirira za chitsulo zinayamba kugwiritsidwa ntchito.

en: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man).
ny: Njira yoyamba yodziŵika ya kayendedwe inali kuyenda, anthu anayamba kuyenda mowongoka zaka mamiliyoni aŵiri zapitazo ndi kutuluka kwa Homo Erectus (kutanthauza munthu wowongoka).

en: Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually.
ny: Anthu amene analipo kale, otchedwa Australopithecus, sankayenda mowongoka ngati mmene ankachitira nthawi zonse.

en: Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.
ny: Zokhazikika za bipedal zimapezeka mu zofukula za Australopithecus kuyambira zaka 4.2-3.9 miliyoni zapitazo, ngakhale Sahelanthropus atha kukhala atayenda pamapazi awiri koyambirira zaka 7 miliyoni zapitazo.

en: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree.
ny: Tingathe kuyamba kukhala ndi moyo wosamalira chilengedwe, tingathe kuloŵa nawo m'zochitika za chilengedwe, ndipo tingathe kukhala anthu ochita zinthu zolimbikitsa kuti tithe kuchepetsa kuvutika kwa m'tsogolo.

en: This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them.
ny: Komabe, ngati sitikufuna njira yothetsera mavutowo, ndiye kuti tiyenera kupeza chimene chikuchititsa mavutowo ndi kuwachotsa.

en: It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.
ny: N'zoonekeratu kuti dziko lasintha kwambiri chifukwa cha kupita patsogolo kwa sayansi ndi luso la zopangapanga, ndipo mavuto akhala aakulu chifukwa cha kuchuluka kwa anthu ndi moyo wa anthu wonyada.

en: After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap.
ny: Pambuyo pa kulandiridwa kwake ndi Congress pa July 4, mpukutu wolembedwa pamanja wosayinidwa ndi Pulezidenti wa Congress John Hancock ndi Mlembi Charles Thomson kenako unatumizidwa m'mabwalo angapo kumalo osindikizira a John Dunlap.

en: Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as "Dunlap broadsides".
ny: Usiku wonse makope 150 mpaka 200 anapangidwa, tsopano otchedwa "Dunlap broadsides".

en: The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8.
ny: Kuŵerenga koyamba kwa anthu chikalatacho kunachitika ndi John Nixon m'bwalo la Independence Hall pa July 8.

en: One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10.
ny: Limodzi linatumizidwa kwa George Washington pa July 6, amene analiŵerenga kwa asilikali ake ku New York pa July 9. Kope lina linafika ku London pa August 10.

en: The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived.
ny: Mabuku 25 a Dunlap omwe amapezekabe ndi makope akale kwambiri a chikalatachi.

en: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds.
ny: Masiku ano akatswiri ambiri a sayansi ya zinthu zakale amakhulupirira kuti pali gulu limodzi la tizilombo tina tomwe tinapulumuka ndipo tili ndi moyo mpaka pano.

en: Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly.
ny: Anthu ambiri saziona kuti ndi zamoyo za mtundu wa dinosaur chifukwa chakuti zili ndi nthenga ndipo zimatha kuuluka.

en: But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur.
ny: Koma pali zinthu zambiri zokhudza mbalame zimene zimaoneka ngati dinosaur.

en: They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.
ny: Amakhala ndi mapazi okhala ndi makoswe ndi zala, amaika mazira, ndipo amayenda pa miyendo yawo iŵiri yakumbuyo ngati T-Rex.

en: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers.
ny: Makompyuta onse amene akugwiritsidwa ntchito lerolino kwenikweni amadalira kusokoneza chidziŵitso chimene chimalembedwa m'mawu a manambala a binary.

en: A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.
ny: Chiwerengero cha binary chingakhale ndi chimodzi chokha mwa zinthu ziŵiri, mwachitsanzo 0 kapena 1, ndipo manambala ameneŵa amatchedwa manambala a binary - kapena bits, pogwiritsa ntchito mawu a pakompyuta.

en: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made.
ny: Zizindikiro zake monga kusanza, zimakhala zofala kwambiri moti munthu sangaone ngati ali ndi matendawa nthawi yomweyo.

en: The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals.
ny: Chisonyezero chabwino kwambiri cha poizoni wamkati chingakhale kukhalapo kwa chidebe chotseguka cha mankhwala kapena mankhwala a poizoni a m'nyumba.

en: Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.
ny: Onani pa pepalapo malangizo a mankhwala amene angagwiritsidwe ntchito pochiritsa.

en: The term bug is used by entomologists in a formal sense for this group of insects.
ny: Akatswiri a nthomba amagwiritsa ntchito mawu akuti nyongolotsi ponena za gulu la tizilombo timeneti.

en: This term derives from ancient familiarity with Bed-bugs, which are insects highly adapted to parasitize humans.
ny: Mawu ameneŵa amachokera ku chibadwa chakale cha anthu omwe ankadziŵa bwino tizilombo timene timakhala ngati tizilombo tomwe timapweteka anthu.

en: Both Assassin-bugs and Bed-bugs are nidicolous, adapted to living in nest or housing of their host.
ny: Nkhono za Assassin ndi Bed-bugs zonse ndi zosaoneka bwino, zimatha kukhala m'nyumba kapena m'nyumba za anthu amene amazisunga.

en: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults.
ny: Ku United States of America konse, kuli pafupifupi 400,000 odziŵika ndi matenda a Multiple Sclerosis (MS), akumachititsa kukhala matenda aakulu a mitsempha mwa achikulire achichepere ndi a zaka zapakati.

en: MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve.
ny: Matenda a MS amakhudza ubongo, msana ndi maso.

en: Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.
ny: Kafukufuku wasonyeza kuti akazi ali ndi mwayi wochuluka wochuluka kawiri kuposa amuna wokhala ndi MS.

en: A couple may decide it is not in their best interest, or in the interest of their child, to raise a baby.
ny: Mwamuna ndi mkazi wake angaganize kuti kulera mwana n'kosathandiza kwa iwo kapena kwa mwana wawo.

en: These couples may choose to make an adoption plan for their baby.
ny: Mabanja ameneŵa angasankhe kupanga pulani ya kulera mwana wawo.

en: In an adoption, the birth parents terminate their parental rights so that another couple may parent the child.
ny: Pa nkhani ya mwana woleredwa, makolo enieniwo amasiya udindo wawo monga makolo kuti mwamuna ndi mkazi wina azitha kulera mwanayo.

en: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research.
ny: Cholinga chachikulu cha sayansi ndicho kupeza mmene dziko limagwirira ntchito kupyolera mu njira ya sayansi. Njira imeneyi kwenikweni ndiyo imatsogolera kufufuza kwa sayansi.

en: It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.
ny: Komabe, si kuyesa kokha, ndipo kuyesa ndi kuyesa kumene kumagwiritsidwa ntchito kuchotsa lingaliro limodzi kapena angapo, kufunsa mafunso, ndi kupanga zowona komanso kutsogolera kufufuza kwa sayansi.

en: Naturalists and philosophers focused on classical texts and, in particular, on the Bible in Latin.
ny: Akatswiri a sayansi ya zachilengedwe ndiponso akatswiri a nzeru za anthu ankayesetsa kufufuza kwambiri mabuku akale, makamaka Baibulo lachilatini.

en: Accepted were Aristotle's views on all matters of science, including psychology.
ny: Anthu ambiri ankakhulupirira maganizo a Aristotle pa nkhani zonse za sayansi, kuphatikizapo maganizo.

en: As knowledge of Greek declined, the West found itself cut off from its Greek philosophical and scientific roots.
ny: Pamene chidziŵitso cha Chigiriki chinatsika, Kumadzulo kunadzipeza kuti kwatha ndi mizu yake ya chigiriki ya nzeru ndi sayansi.

en: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks.
ny: Zizoloŵezi zambiri zowonedwa m'thupi ndi khalidwe kaŵirikaŵiri zimadalira kwambiri kukhalapo kwa ma cycles a mkati ndi kupanga kwawo kupyolera mu maora a zamoyo.

en: Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals.
ny: Zizindikiro za nyengo, zomwe sizimangokhala mayankho a zizindikiro zakunja, zalembedwa pa zamoyo zambiri, kuphatikizapo mabakiteriya, bowa, zomera, ndi nyama.

en: Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.
ny: Mawotchi a zinthu zamoyo ndi oscillators amene amadzichirikiza okha ndipo amapitirizabe kuyenda ngakhale kuti palibe chilichonse chimene chimawachititsa kuti asamachite zinthu zina.

en: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material.
ny: Kuyesera kwa Hershey ndi Chase kunali chimodzi mwa zisonyezero zazikulu kuti DNA inali zinthu za majini.

en: Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium.
ny: Hershey ndi Chase anagwiritsa ntchito ma phage, kapena kuti mavairasi, kuti apange DNA yawo m'mabakiteriya.

en: They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.
ny: Iwo anachita mayesero aŵiri polemba DNA ya mu phage ndi phosphorous ya radioactive kapena mapuloteni a phage ndi sulfure ya radioactive.

en: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells.
ny: Kusintha kwa maselo kungakhale ndi zotsatira zosiyanasiyana malinga ndi mtundu wa kusintha kwa maselo, kufunika kwa chigawo cha zinthu za m'majini zomwe zawonongeka ndi ngati maselo omwe akukhudzidwa ndi maselo a m'majini.

en: Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.
ny: Kusintha kwa maselo a m'mazira a m'chiberekero ndi kumene kungaloŵetse ana, pamene kusintha kwa maselo kwina kungachititse kuti maselo afe kapena kuti akhale ndi kansa.

en: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife.
ny: Ulendo wa zachilengedwe umakopa anthu amene amafuna kupita kukaona malo achilengedwe n'cholinga choti akasangalale ndi malowo, kuphatikizapo nyama ndi zomera.

en: Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem.
ny: Zitsanzo za ntchito zimene zimachitika pa malowo ndi monga kusaka, kusodza, kujambula zithunzi, kuonerera mbalame, kupita ku mapaki ndi kuphunzira zinthu zokhudza chilengedwe.

en: An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.
ny: Chitsanzo ndi kupita kukaona, kujambula zithunzi, ndi kuphunzira za ma organgatuang ku Borneo.

en: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left.
ny: M'mawa uliwonse, anthu amachoka m'matauni ang'onoang'ono a kumidzi ndi magalimoto kupita kuntchito kwawo ndipo amadutsa ndi ena amene ntchito yawo ikupita kumene achoka kumene.

en: In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars.
ny: Mu galimoto yamtunduwu, aliyense ali ndi njira yolumikizirana ndi galimoto ya munthu payekha, ndipo aliyense amathandiza pa kayendedwe ka galimoto.

en: Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.
ny: Sayansi tsopano ikusonyeza kuti chuma chachikulu cha carbon chimenechi chachotsa biosphere m'modzi mwa maiko ake okhazikika amene wakhala akuthandiza chitukuko cha anthu kwa zaka mamiliyoni aŵiri zapitazi.

en: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems.
ny: Aliyense amatenga nawo mbali m'chitaganya ndipo amagwiritsa ntchito njira zoyendera.

en: In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down.
ny: M'maiko otukuka kaŵirikaŵiri simumva madandaulo ofanana ndi ameneŵa ponena za mkhalidwe wa madzi kapena milatho yogwa.

en: Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?
ny: Kodi akatswiri a kayendedwe ka zinthu ndi osadziŵa ntchito zawo? Kapena kodi pali chinachake chofunika kwambiri chimene chikuchitika?

en: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another.
ny: Kuyenda kwa magalimoto ndi kuphunzira za kayendedwe ka madalaivala ndi magalimoto pakati pa mfundo ziwiri ndi momwe amagwirira ntchito wina ndi mnzake.

en: Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty.
ny: Koma n'zomvetsa chisoni kuti kuphunzira mmene magalimoto amayendera n'kovuta chifukwa chakuti sitingathe kudziwiratu bwinobwino khalidwe la dalaivala.

en: Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically.
ny: Mwamwayi, madalaivala amakonda kuchita zinthu mosasinthasintha; motero, magalimoto amayenda mosasinthasintha ndipo amatha kufotokozedwa mwachidule.

en: To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity.
ny: Kuti anthu azitha kuyenda bwino, anthu ena anapeza kuti pali kugwirizana pakati pa zinthu zitatu zikuluzikulu monga: (1) kuyenda bwino kwa magalimoto, (2) kuchuluka kwa magalimoto, ndiponso (3) liwiro.

en: These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.
ny: Ubale umenewu umathandiza pokonza, kupanga, ndi kuyendetsa misewu.

en: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently.
ny: Nyamazi zinali zamoyo zoyamba kutuluka m'mlengalenga ndipo zinatha kuthawa adani mosavuta komanso kupeza chakudya ndi anzawo.

en: Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body.
ny: Tizilombo timeneti timatha kupindika mapiko ake n'kuyamba kuuluka.

en: This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators.
ny: Zimenezi zimawapatsa malo ambiri oti abisale kwa nyama zolusa.

en: Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.
ny: Masiku ano, tizilombo tokha tomwe sitingapinde mapiko athu ndi ntchentche za m'nkhalango ndi za m'nkhalango.

en: Thousands of years ago, a man called Aristarchus said that the Solar System moved around the Sun.
ny: Zaka zikwi zambiri zapitazo, munthu wina dzina lake Aristarko ananena kuti dzuwa ndi mapulaneti ena onse zimayenda mozungulira dzuwa.

en: Some people thought he was right but many people believed the opposite; that the Solar System moved around the Earth, including the Sun (and even the other stars).
ny: Anthu ena ankaganiza kuti anali kulondola koma anthu ambiri ankakhulupirira zosiyana ndi zimenezo; kuti Dzuŵa limayenda mozungulira Dziko Lapansi, kuphatikizapo dzuŵa (ndipo ngakhale nyenyezi zina).

en: This seems sensible, because the Earth doesn't feel as if it's moving, does it?
ny: Zimenezi zikuoneka zomveka, chifukwa chakuti Dziko lapansi silimva ngati kuti likuyenda, kodi si choncho?

en: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river.
ny: Mtsinje wa Amazon ndiwo mtsinje wachiŵiri wautali kwambiri ndiponso waukulu kwambiri padziko lapansi.

en: The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide.
ny: Amazon ndi mtsinje waukulu kwambiri padziko lapansi, nthaŵi zina uli ndi m'lifupi wa makilomita asanu ndi limodzi.

en: A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon.
ny: Madzi okwanira 20 peresenti amene amatuluka m'mitsinje ya dziko lapansi kuloŵa m'nyanja zimachokera ku Amazon.

en: The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.
ny: Mtsinje waukulu wa Amazon uli ndi mtunda wa makilomita 6,387, ndipo umapeza madzi kuchokera ku mitsinje ina yaing'ono yambirimbiri.

en: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction.
ny: Ngakhale kuti ntchito yomanga mapiramidi a miyala inapitiriza mpaka kumapeto kwa Ufumu Wakale, mapiramidi a Giza sanapitirirepo kukula kwake ndi luso lapamwamba la zomangamanga.

en: New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.
ny: Anthu a ku Igupto wakale a mu Ufumu Watsopano anadabwa ndi zipilala za anthu akale, zomwe panthaŵiyo zinali ndi zaka zoposa chikwi chimodzi.

en: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population.
ny: Mzinda wa Vatican uli ndi anthu pafupifupi 800, ndipo ndi dziko laling'ono kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi komanso ndi limene lili ndi anthu ochepa kwambiri.

en: Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications.
ny: Mzinda wa Vatican umagwiritsa ntchito Chitaliyana polemba malamulo komanso pochita zinthu zina.

en: Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies.
ny: Chitaliyana ndi chinenero cha tsiku ndi tsiku chomwe chimagwiritsidwanso ntchito ndi ambiri mwa anthu amene amagwira ntchito m'boma pamene Chilatini chimagwiritsidwanso ntchito pa miyambo yachipembedzo.

en: All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.
ny: Nzika zonse za Vatican City ndi za Roma Katolika.

en: People have known about basic chemical elements such as gold, silver, and copper from antiquity, as these can all be discovered in nature in native form and are relatively simple to mine with primitive tools.
ny: Anthu akhala akudziŵa za zinthu za m'makemikolo monga golidi, siliva, ndi mkuwa kuyambira kale, chifukwa chakuti zonsezi zingapezeke m'chilengedwe m'njira ya mtundu wawo ndipo n'zosavuta kuzigwiritsa ntchito pogwiritsa ntchito zipangizo zoyambirira.

en: Aristotle, a philosopher, theorised that everything is made up of a mixture of one or more of four elements. They were earth, water, air, and fire.
ny: Aristotle, yemwe anali katswiri wa nzeru za anthu, ananena kuti zinthu zonse zimapangidwa ndi zinthu zinayi, zomwe ndi nthaka, madzi, mpweya ndi moto.

en: This was more like the four states of matter (in the same order): solid, liquid, gas, and plasma, though he also theorised that they change into new substances to form what we see.
ny: Zimenezi zinali zofanana kwambiri ndi zinthu zinayi za m'chilengedwe (m'dongosolo lomwelo): zolimba, zamadzimadzi, zamagesi, ndi plasma, ngakhale kuti iye ananenanso kuti zinthu zimenezi zimasintha n'kukhala zinthu zatsopano kuti zikhale zimene timaziona.

en: Alloys are basically a mixture of two or more metals. Don't forget that there are many elements on the periodic table.
ny: M'mawu ena, ma alloys ndi osakaniza zitsulo ziwiri kapena zingapo.

en: Elements like calcium and potassium are considered metals. Of course, there are also metals like silver and gold.
ny: Zinthu monga calcium ndi potassium zimaonedwa ngati zitsulo.

en: You can also have alloys that include small amounts of non-metallic elements like carbon.
ny: Mungathenso kukhala ndi ma alloys omwe ali ndi zinthu zochepa zosakhala zachitsulo monga carbon.

en: Everything in the Universe is made of matter. All matter is made of tiny particles called atoms.
ny: Zinthu zonse m'chilengedwechi zimapangidwa ndi tinthu tating'onoting'ono kwambiri timene timatchedwa maatomu.

en: Atoms are so incredibly tiny that trillions of them could fit into the period at the end of this sentence.
ny: Maatomu ndi aang'ono kwambiri moti mabiliyoni ambiri angalowe m'gawo limene lili kumapeto kwa mawu awa.

en: Thus, the pencil was a good friend to many people when it came out.
ny: Choncho, pamene penshoni inatulutsidwa, anthu ambiri anali nayo.

en: Sadly, as newer methods of writing have emerged, the pencil has been relegated to lesser status and uses.
ny: N'zomvetsa chisoni kuti popeza kuti masiku ano anthu akulemba zinthu m'njira zatsopano, anthu ambiri saigwiritsa ntchito kwambiri.

en: People now write messages on computer screens, never having to come close to a sharpener.
ny: Anthu tsopano amalemba mauthenga pa kompyuta, popanda kuyandikira makina oŵeta.

en: One can only wonder what the keyboard will become when something newer comes along.
ny: Munthu angadabwe kuti kodi kiyibodi idzakhala yotani pamene chinthu chatsopano chidzafika.

en: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons.
ny: Bomba la kuphulika limagwira ntchito motsatira mfundo yakuti pamafunika mphamvu kuti pakhale nyukiliya yokhala ndi ma proton ndi ma neutron ambiri.

en: Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy.
ny: Zili ngati kukwera ngolo yolemera paphiri, n'kugawanitsa nyukiliya n'kutulutsa mphamvu zina.

en: Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.
ny: Maatomu ena amakhala ndi nyukiliya zosakhazikika zomwe zikutanthauza kuti zimatha kusweka popanda kupanikizika.

en: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust.
ny: M'mwamba mwa mwezi muli miyala ndi fumbi ndipo mbali yakunja ya mwezi imatchedwa kuti thanthwe.

en: The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side.
ny: Mtundu wa nthaka uli ndi makilomita 70 m'mimba mwawo ndipo mbali ina ndi ya makilomita 100.

en: It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands.
ny: M'madera a maria muli madzi ochepa kwambiri ndipo m'madera a kumapiri muli madzi ambiri.

en: There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.
ny: M'mphepete mwa nyanjayi munkakhala madzi ambiri chifukwa chakuti nthaka inali yochepa kwambiri.

en: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them.
ny: Maganizo a zinthu amakhala ofunikira kupeza chimene chimachititsa anthu kukopeka kapena chimene chimawakopa.

en: These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood.
ny: Malingaliro ameneŵa akusonyeza kuti anthu ali ndi zosoŵa zina ndi/kapena zikhumbo zimene zakhala zikugonjetsedwa pamene akukula kufika paunyamata.

en: These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things.
ny: Maganizo ameneŵa amafufuza zimene zimachititsa anthu ena kufuna zinthu zimene amachita ndi zimene zimawachititsa kuchita kapena kusachita zinthu zina.

en: Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.
ny: Ziphunzitso ziwiri zotchuka kwambiri ndi za Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory ndi Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

en: Generally speaking, two behaviors can emerge as managers begin to lead their former peers. One end of the spectrum is trying to remain “one of the guys” (or gals).
ny: Nthawi zambiri, anthu amene ali ndi udindo woyang'anira anzawo amasonyeza makhalidwe awiri.

en: This type of manager has difficulty making unpopular decisions, performing disciplinary action, performance evaluations, assigning responsibility, and holding people accountable.
ny: Oyang'anira otereŵa amavutika kupanga zosankha zosakondweretsa anthu, kupereka chilango, kuunika ntchito, kupatsa ena udindo, ndi kufunsa anthu kuti aziyankha.

en: At the other end of the spectrum, one morphs into an unrecognizable individual that feels he or she must change everything the team has been doing and make it their own.
ny: Kumapeto kwa gululi, munthu wina amakhala munthu wosadziŵika amene amaona kuti ayenera kusintha zonse zimene gulu lakhala likuchita ndi kuzipanga kukhala zake.

en: After all, the leader is ultimately responsible for the success and failure of the team.
ny: Ndipotu mtsogoleri ndi amene amachititsa kuti gulu liziyenda bwino kapena kulephera.

en: This behavior oftentimes results in rifts between the leaders and the rest of the team.
ny: Kaŵirikaŵiri khalidwe limeneli limapangitsa kuti atsogoleri ndi ena onse a m'gulu asokonezeke.

en: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences.
ny: Magulu a anthu amene ali ndi luso lotha kuchita zinthu ngati mmene magulu a anthu amene ali ndi luso lotha kuchita zinthu ngati mmene magulu a anthu wamba amachitira, koma pali kusiyana kochepa.

en: Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group.
ny: Anthu amene ali m'gulu la anthu amene ali ndi vutoli nthawi zambiri amakhala ngati anthu amene angagwirizane ndi gulu lawo.

en: They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management.
ny: Nthawi zambiri amakhala ndi ufulu wochita zinthu m'njira zosiyanasiyana kusiyana ndi anthu ena chifukwa chakuti magulu awo amatha kusonkhana m'madera osiyanasiyana a nthawi, ndipo anthu a m'deralo sangamvetse zimenezi.

en: The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team.
ny: Kukhalapo kwa gulu lenileni "losadziŵika" (Larson ndi LaFasto, 1989, p109) kulinso mbali yapadera ya gulu lenileni.

en: The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.
ny: Gulu losadziŵika ndi anthu amene ali m'gululi ndi gulu la anthu amene ali ndi udindo woyang'anira gululi, ndipo gulu losadziŵika ndi anthuwo ndi limene limayendetsa gululi.

en: Why would an organization want to go through the time consuming process of establishing a learning organization? One goal for putting organizational learning concepts into practice is innovation.
ny: Chifukwa chiyani bungwe liyenera kufuna kudutsa njira yotenga nthawi yokhazikitsa bungwe lophunzirira? Cholinga chimodzi cha kukhazikitsa malingaliro ophunzirira bungwe ndi luso.

en: When all available resources are effectively used across the functional departments of an organization, creativity and ingenuity can transpire.
ny: Pamene zinthu zonse zimene zilipo zikugwiritsidwa ntchito moyenera m'madipatimenti onse a bungwe, anthu amatha kupanga zinthu mwaluso.

en: As a result, the process of an organization working together to overcome an obstacle can lead to a new innovative process to serve the customer's need.
ny: Zotsatira zake, ntchito ya bungwe kugwira ntchito limodzi kuthetsa chotchinga zingachititse njira yatsopano luso kutumikira zosowa kasitomala.

en: Before an organization can be innovative, leadership must create a culture of innovation as well as shared knowledge and organizational learning.
ny: Gulu lisanayambe kupanga zinthu zatsopano, utsogoleri uyenera kukhazikitsa chikhalidwe cha zinthu zatsopano komanso chidziŵitso chogaŵanika ndi kuphunzira kwa gulu.

en: Angel (2006), explains the Continuum approach as a method being used to help organizations reach a higher level of performance.
ny: Angel (2006), akufotokoza njira ya Continuum monga njira yogwiritsiridwa ntchito kuthandiza mabungwe kufika pamlingo wapamwamba wa ntchito.

en: Neurobiological data provide physical evidence for a theoretical approach to the investigation of cognition. Therefore it narrows the research area and makes it much more exact.
ny: Mauthenga a neurobiological amapereka umboni wa sayansi ya sayansi kuti apange njira yofufuzira za chidziwitso.

en: The correlation between brain pathology and behaviour supports scientists in their research.
ny: Kugwirizana kwa matenda a ubongo ndi khalidwe kumathandiza asayansi pa kafukufuku wawo.

en: It has been known for a long time that different types of brain damage, traumas, lesions, and tumours affect behaviour and cause changes in some mental functions.
ny: Anthu akhala akudziŵa kwa nthaŵi yaitali kuti mitundu yosiyanasiyana ya kuwonongeka kwa ubongo, mabala, mabala, ndi zotupa zimakhudza khalidwe ndi kusintha kwa ntchito zina za maganizo.

en: The rise of new technologies allows us to see and investigate brain structures and processes never seen before.
ny: Kupita patsogolo kwa luso lamakono kumatithandiza kuona ndi kufufuza mmene ubongo umapangidwira ndi mmene umagwirira ntchito.

en: This provides us with a lot of information and material to build simulation models which help us to understand processes in our mind.
ny: Zimenezi zimatipatsa chidziŵitso ndi zinthu zambiri zoti tizipanga zitsanzo zoyerekezera zomwe zimatithandiza kumvetsetsa mmene maganizo athu amagwirira ntchito.

en: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine.
ny: Ngakhale kuti AI ili ndi tanthauzo lolimba la sayansi, AI ndi nthambi yofunika kwambiri ya sayansi ya kompyuta, yomwe imakhudzana ndi khalidwe, kuphunzira ndi kusintha kwa nzeru mu makina.

en: Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior.
ny: Kafukufuku wa AI amaphatikizapo kupanga makina kuti azitha kugwira ntchito zomwe zimafuna khalidwe lanzeru.

en: Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face.
ny: Zitsanzo zake ndi monga kulamulira, kukonzekera ndi kukonza nthawi, kuthekera kuyankha mafunso ndi matenda a makasitomala, komanso kuzindikira kalembedwe ka manja, mawu ndi nkhope.

en: Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems.
ny: Zinthu zoterozo zakhala maphunziro osiyana, amene amayang'ana kwambiri kupereka mayankho a mavuto a moyo weniweni.

en: The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.
ny: Makina a AI tsopano amagwiritsidwa ntchito kaŵirikaŵiri m'madera a zachuma, mankhwala, zomangamanga ndi zankhondo, monga momwe zakhalira m'makompyuta angapo apanyumba ndi mapulogalamu a masewera a kanema.

en: Field trips are a large part of any classroom. Quite often a teacher would love to take her students places to which a bus trip is not an option.
ny: Kaŵirikaŵiri mphunzitsi angakonde kupita ndi ophunzira ake kumalo kumene ulendo wa basi suli njira.

en: Technology offers the solution with virtual field trips. Students can look at museum artifacts, visit an aquarium, or admire beautiful art while sitting with their class.
ny: Anthu amene ali ndi luso la zopangapanga amatha kupita kukaona malo osiyanasiyana, kukaona zinthu zakale, kukaona malo osungiramo nsomba, kapena kukaona zinthu zokongola zimene anthu amapanga.

en: Sharing a field trip virtually is also a great way to reflect a on a trip and share experiences with future classes.
ny: Kugawana ulendo wa ku sukulu ndi njira yabwino kwambiri yosonyezera ulendowo ndi kugawana zokumana nazo ndi makalasi amtsogolo.

en: For example, each year students from Bennet School in North Carolina design a website about their trip to the State Capital, each year the website gets remodeled, but old versions are kept online to serve as a scrapbook.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, chaka chilichonse ophunzira a ku Bennet School ku North Carolina amapanga webusaiti yokhudza ulendo wawo wopita ku likulu la dzikoli, chaka chilichonse webusaitiyi imakonzedwanso, koma mabaibulo akale amasungidwa pa intaneti kuti akhale ngati kabuku ka zinthu zakale.

en: Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that.
ny: Mabulogu amathandizanso kukonza kulemba kwa ophunzira. Ngakhale ophunzira nthawi zambiri amayamba blog yawo ndi galamala ndi kalembedwe kosasamala, kupezeka kwa omvera nthawi zambiri kumasintha izi.

en: Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism.
ny: Popeza kuti ophunzira kaŵirikaŵiri amakhala omvetsera otsutsa kwambiri, wolemba mabulogu amayamba kuyesetsa kusintha kulemba kuti apeŵe kutsutsidwa.

en: Also blogging "forces students to become more savvy about the world around them." The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004).
ny: Ndiponso kulemba mabulogu "kumakakamiza ophunzira kuti adziŵe zambiri za dziko lowazungulira". Kufunika kokondweretsa omvetsera kumalimbikitsa ophunzira kukhala anzeru ndi osangalatsa (Toto, 2004).

en: Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day.
ny: Kulemba mabulogu ndi chida cholimbikitsa kugwirizana, ndipo kumalimbikitsa ophunzira kuti apitirize kuphunzira kuposa tsiku la sukulu.

en: Appropriate use of blogs "can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002).
ny: Kugwiritsa ntchito bwino ma blogs "kungathandize ophunzira kukhala ochita kusanthula ndi kutsutsa kwambiri; mwa kuyankha mwakhama ku zipangizo za pa Intaneti, ophunzira angathe kufotokoza malingaliro awo pazolemba za ena komanso kufotokoza malingaliro awo pa nkhani zina (Oravec, 2002).

en: Ottawa is Canada's charming, bilingual capital and features an array of art galleries and museums that showcase Canada's past and present.
ny: Ottawa ndi likulu lokongola la Canada, lomwe lili ndi zinenero ziwiri, ndipo lili ndi malo osungiramo zinthu zakale ndi malo osungiramo zinthu zakale amene amasonyeza mbiri yakale ya dziko la Canada.

en: Farther south is Niagara Falls and the north is home to the untapped natural beauty of the Muskoka and beyond.
ny: Kum'mwera kuli mathithi a Niagara ndipo kumpoto kuli kukongola kwachilengedwe kosagwiritsiridwa ntchito kwa Muskoka ndi kupitirira.

en: All these things and more highlight Ontario as what is considered quintessentially Canadian by outsiders.
ny: Zinthu zonsezi ndi zina zambiri zimasonyeza kuti anthu a kunja kwa dziko la Ontario amaona kuti ndi dziko la Canada.

en: Large areas further north are quite sparsely populated and some is nearly uninhabited wilderness.
ny: Madera aakulu kumpoto ali ndi anthu ochepa kwambiri ndipo ena ali ngati chipululu chosakhala ndi anthu.

en: For a comparison of population that surprises many: There are more African Americans living in the US than there are Canadian citizens.
ny: Poyerekeza anthu ambiri, zomwe zimadabwitsa anthu ambiri: Pali anthu ambiri a mtundu wa Afirika okhala ku United States kuposa nzika za ku Canada.

en: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa.
ny: Zilumba za Kum'mawa kwa Africa zili m'Nyanja ya Indian pafupi ndi gombe la kum'mawa kwa Africa.

en: Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife.
ny: Madagascar ndi dziko lalikulu kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi, ndipo lili ndi nyama zamoyo zambirimbiri.

en: Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts.
ny: Zilumba zambiri zing'onozing'ono ndi mayiko odziimira okha, kapena ogwirizana ndi France, ndipo amadziwika kuti malo odyera otchuka.

en: The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte.
ny: Maarabu anabweretsanso Chisilamu m'mayikowo, ndipo chinatenga anthu ambiri ku Comoros ndi Mayotte.

en: European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.
ny: Anthu a ku Ulaya anayamba kukopeka ndi atsamunda m'zaka za m'ma 1500, pamene wofufuza malo wa ku Portugal, dzina lake Vasco da Gama, anapeza njira ya ku Cape yochokera ku Ulaya kupita ku India.

en: In the north the region is bounded by the Sahel, and in the south and west by the Atlantic Ocean.
ny: Kumpoto dera limeneli lili ndi nyanja ya Sahel, ndipo kum'mwera ndi kumadzulo kuli nyanja ya Atlantic.

en: Women: It is recommended that any women travellers say that they are married, regardless of actual marital status.
ny: Akazi: Anthu amene akupita kukaona malowa ayenera kunena kuti ali pa banja, mosaganizira za mmene zinthu zilili pa moyo wawo.

en: It is helpful to also wear a ring (just not one that looks too expensive.
ny: Ndi bwino kuvala mphete (koma osati imene imaoneka ngati yokwera mtengo kwambiri.

en: Women should realize that cultural differences may result in what they would consider harassment and it is not uncommon to be followed, grabbed by the arm, etc.
ny: Akazi ayenera kuzindikira kuti kusiyana kwa chikhalidwe kungachititse kuti anthu azingogwiriridwa ndipo si zachilendo kuti anthu azitsatiridwa, kugwiriridwa dzanja, ndi zina zotero.

en: Be firm in turning down men, and don't be afraid to stand your ground (cultural differences or not, it doesn't make it ok!).
ny: Khalani olimba pakukana amuna, ndipo musaope kuima (kusiyana kwa chikhalidwe kapena ayi, sikumapangitsa kukhala bwino!).

en: The modern city of Casablanca was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BCE, and was used by the Phoenicians, Romans, and the Merenids as a strategic port called Anfa.
ny: Mzinda wamakono wa Casablanca unakhazikitsidwa ndi asodzi a ku Berber m'zaka za zana la 10 BCE, ndipo unagwiritsidwa ntchito ndi Afoinike, Aroma, ndi a Merenid ngati doko lotchedwa Anfa.

en: The Portuguese destroyed it and rebuilt it under the name Casa Branca, only to abandon it after an earthquake in 1755.
ny: A Chipwitikizi anauiwononga ndi kuiyambitsanso ndi dzina lakuti Casa Branca, koma anaisiya chifukwa cha chivomezi mu 1755.

en: The Moroccan sultan rebuilt the city as Daru l-Badya and it was given the name Casablanca by Spanish traders who established trading bases there.
ny: Mfumu ya ku Morocco inamangiranso mzindawu monga Daru l-Badya ndipo unapatsidwa dzina lakuti Casablanca ndi amalonda a ku Spain amene anakhazikitsa malo ogulitsa malonda kumeneko.

en: Casablanca is one of the least interesting places to shop in all of Morocco.
ny: Casablanca ndi imodzi mwa malo osangalatsa kwambiri kugula zinthu ku Morocco konse.

en: Around the old Medina it's easy to find places selling traditional Moroccan goods, such as tagines, pottery, leather goods, hookahs, and a whole spectrum of geegaws, but it's all for the tourists.
ny: Kuzungulira Medina wakale kuli kosavuta kupeza malo ogulitsa zinthu zachikhalidwe za ku Morocco, monga tagines, ziwiya zadothi, zinthu za zikopa, ma hookah, ndi mitundu yonse ya ma geegaw, koma zonsezo ndi za alendo.

en: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda.
ny: Goma ndi mzinda wa alendo ku Democratic Republic of Congo kum'mawa kwenikweni pafupi ndi Rwanda.

en: In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town’s streets, particularly the town centre.
ny: Mu 2002 Goma anawonongedwa ndi madzi a m'phiri la Nyiragongo amene anaika m'manda misewu yambiri ya m'tauniyo, makamaka pakati pa mzindawo.

en: While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province.
ny: Ngakhale kuti Goma ndi malo otetezeka, anthu amene amapita kunja kwa mzindawu ayenera kufufuza kuti adziwe mmene nkhondo ikuyendera m'chigawo cha North Kivu.

en: The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa.
ny: Mzindawu ndi malo okwerapo phiri la Nyiragongo limodzi ndi malo ena otsika mtengo kwambiri okwera mapiri a Gorilla ku Africa.

en: You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.
ny: Mukhoza kugwiritsa ntchito boda-boda (tekisi ya njinga yamoto) kuti muyende mozungulira Goma. Mtengo wamba (wam'deralo) ndi ~ 500 Congolese Francs paulendo waufupi.

en: Combined with its relative inaccessibility, "Timbuktu" has come to be used as a metaphor for exotic, distant lands.
ny: Chifukwa chakuti anthu ambiri safikako, dzina lakuti "Timbuktu" limagwiritsidwa ntchito ponena za malo enaake achilendo, akutali.

en: Today, Timbuktu is an impoverished town, although its reputation makes it a tourist attraction, and it has an airport.
ny: Masiku ano, mzinda wa Timbuktu ndi wosauka, ngakhale kuti ndi wotchuka kwambiri ndipo alendo amabwera kudzaona mzindawu, komanso uli ndi bwalo la ndege.

en: In 1990, it was added to the list of world heritage sites in danger, due to the threat of desert sands.
ny: Mu 1990, anaikamo m'gulu la malo amene ali pangozi chifukwa cha mchenga wa m'chipululu.

en: It was one of the major stops during Henry Louis Gates' PBS special Wonders of the African World.
ny: Unali umodzi mwa malo aakulu kwambiri pa PBS yapadera ya Henry Louis Gates ya Zodabwitsa za Dziko la Africa.

en: The city is in stark contrast to the rest of the country's cities, because it has more of an Arabic flair than of an African.
ny: Mzindawu umasiyana kwambiri ndi mizinda ina ya m'dzikolo, chifukwa chakuti uli ndi luso lachiarabu kuposa la mu Afirika.

en: The Kruger National Park (KNP) lies in the north-east of South Africa and runs along the border of Mozambique in the east, Zimbabwe in the north, and the southern border is the Crocodile River.
ny: Malo otchedwa Kruger National Park (KNP) ali kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa South Africa ndipo ali m'malire ndi dziko la Mozambique kum'mawa, Zimbabwe kumpoto, ndipo malire ake akum'mwera ndi mtsinje wa Crocodile.

en: The park covers 19,500 km² and is divided in 14 different ecozones, each supporting different wildlife.
ny: Malowa ali ndi malo okwana 19,500 km2 ndipo ali ndi malo 14 a zachilengedwe, ndipo malo onsewa ali ndi zinyama zosiyanasiyana.

en: It is one of the main attractions of South Africa and it is considered the flagship of South African National Parks (SANParks).
ny: Ndi chimodzi mwa zokopa zazikulu za South Africa ndipo zimaonedwa ngati flagship ya South African National Parks (SANParks).

en: As with all South African National Parks, there are daily conservation and entry fees for the park.
ny: Monga mmene zilili ndi mapaki onse a ku South Africa, pali malipiro a tsiku ndi tsiku a kuteteza ndi kuloŵa m'mapaki.

en: It may also be beneficial for one to buy a Wild Card, which provides entry to either selections of parks in South Africa or all of the South African National Parks.
ny: Kungakhale kothandiza kugula Wild Card, imene imapereka mwayi woloŵa m'mapaki osankhidwa m'South Africa kapena m'mapaki onse a ku South Africa.

en: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus.
ny: Chilumba cha Hong Kong n'chimene chinapatsa dzina la mzindawu ndipo alendo ambiri amaona kuti ndi malo amene anthu amakonda kwambiri.

en: The parade of buildings that make the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering bar chart that is made apparent by the presence of the waters of Victoria Harbour.
ny: Nyumba zimene zimapanga mzinda wa Hong Kong zikuoneka ngati mapu a mizati yowala kwambiri, ndipo madzi a m'chombo cha Victoria amaoneka bwino kwambiri.

en: To get the best views of Hong Kong, leave the island and head for the Kowloon waterfront opposite.
ny: Kuti muone bwino kwambiri Hong Kong, chokani pachilumbachi ndi kupita ku gombe la Kowloon.

en: The great majority of Hong Kong Island's urban development is densely packed on reclaimed land along the northern shore.
ny: Malo ambiri amene anthu amakhala m'mizinda ya pachilumba cha Hong Kong ali ndi malo ambiri amene anthu anakawagwiritsanso ntchito m'mphepete mwa nyanja ya kumpoto.

en: This is the place the British colonisers took as their own and so if you are looking for evidence of the territory's colonial past, this is a good place to start.
ny: Malowa ndi amene anadzakhala a atsamunda a ku Britain ndipo ngati mukufuna kupeza umboni wa mbiri ya atsamunda a m'derali, ndi malo abwino kuyambapo.

en: The Sundarbans are the largest littoral mangrove belt in the world, stretching 80 km (50 mi) into the Bangladeshi and Indian hinterland from the coast.
ny: Madera a Sundarbans ndi malo aakulu kwambiri a mitengo ya mangrove padziko lonse, ndipo ali ndi mtunda wa makilomita 80 kuchokera ku gombe kupita ku Bangladesh ndi ku India.

en: The Sundarbans has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The part of the forest within Indian territory is called Sundarbans National Park.
ny: Sundarbans yalengezedwa kukhala malo a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Gawo la nkhalango mkati mwa gawo la India limatchedwa Sundarbans National Park.

en: The forests aren't just mangrove swamps though — they include some of the last remaining stands of the mighty jungles which once covered the Gangetic plain.
ny: Nkhalangozi si matope a mitengo ya mangrove okha ayi. Koma zimaphatikizapo malo ena otsalira a nkhalango zamphamvu zimene kale zinali kuphimba chigwa cha Gangetic.

en: The Sundarbans cover an area of 3,850 km², of which about one-third is covered in water/marsh areas.
ny: Madera a Sundarbans ali ndi malo okwana 3,850 km2, ndipo pafupifupi gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu a malowa ali ndi madzi kapena matope.

en: Since 1966 the Sundarbans have been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are now 400 Royal Bengal tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer in the area.
ny: Kuyambira mu 1966 Sundarbans yakhala malo osungira nyama zakutchire, ndipo akuti tsopano pali zimbalangondo za Royal Bengal 400 ndi njati za mabala pafupifupi 30,000 m'deralo.

en: Buses depart the inter-district bus station (across the river) throughout the day, though most, especially those heading to the east and Jakar/Bumthang leave between 06:30 and 07:30.
ny: Mabasi amachoka pa siteshoni ya mabasi a pakati pa zigawo (kudzera kwa mtsinje) tsiku lonse, ngakhale kuti ambiri, makamaka omwe akupita kummawa ndi Jakar / Bumthang amachoka pakati pa 06:30 ndi 07:30.

en: As the inter-district buses are often full, it is advisable to purchase a ticket a few days in advance.
ny: Popeza kuti mabasi a pakati pa zigawo amakhala odzaza, ndi bwino kugula tikiti masiku angapo pasadakhale.

en: Most districts are served by small Japanese Coaster Buses, which are comfortable and sturdy.
ny: Mabasi ang'onoang'ono a ku Japan, omwe ndi abwino ndiponso olimba, amathandiza m'madera ambiri.

en: Shared taxis are a quick and comfortable means to travel to nearby places, such as Paro (Nu 150) and Punakha (Nu 200).
ny: Magalimoto okwera anthu onse ndi njira yachangu komanso yabwino yopitira kumalo apafupi, monga Paro (Nu 150) ndi Punakha (Nu 200).

en: The Oyapock River Bridge is a cable-stayed bridge. It spans the Oyapock River to link the cities of Oiapoque in Brazil and Saint-Georges de l'Oyapock in French Guiana.
ny: Mlatho wa mtsinje wa Oyapock ndi mlatho wa chingwe womwe umadutsa mtsinje wa Oyapock kulumikiza mizinda ya Oiapoque ku Brazil ndi Saint-Georges de l'Oyapock ku French Guiana.

en: The two towers rise to a height of 83 meters, it's 378 meters long and it has two lanes of 3.50 m wide.
ny: Nsanja ziwirizi zimakwera mamita 83, zili ndi mamita 378 ndipo zili ndi misewu iwiri ya mamita 3.50 m'lifupi.

en: The vertical clearance under the bridge is 15 meters. Construction was completed in August 2011, it didn't open to traffic until March 2017.
ny: The ofukula danga pansi pa mlatho ndi mamita 15. yomanga unatha mu August 2011, ndipo sanatsegule magalimoto mpaka March 2017.

en: The bridge is scheduled to be fully operational in September 2017, when the Brazilian customs checkpoints are expected to be finished.
ny: Mlathowu ukuyembekezeka kuyamba kugwira ntchito mu September 2017, pamene malo odulira katundu ku Brazil adzatha.

en: The Guaraní were the most significant indigenous group inhabiting what is now Eastern Paraguay, living as semi-nomadic hunters who also practised subsistence agriculture.
ny: Anthu a mtundu wa Guaraní anali anthu otchuka kwambiri m'dera limene masiku ano limatchedwa kuti kum'mawa kwa Paraguay.

en: The Chaco region was home to other groups of indigenous tribes such as the Guaycurú and Payaguá, who survived by hunting, gathering and fishing.
ny: M'dera la Chaco munkakhalanso mitundu ina ya anthu monga a Guaycurú ndi a Payaguá, omwe ankakonda kusaka, kusonkhanitsa ndi kusodza.

en: In the 16th century Paraguay, formerly called "The Giant Province of the Indies", was born as a result of the encounter of Spanish conquerors with the native indigenous groups.
ny: M'zaka za zana la 16 Paraguay, yomwe kale inkatchedwa "Chigawo Chachikulu cha ku India", inachitika chifukwa cha kukumana kwa opambana a ku Spain ndi magulu a anthu a kumaloko.

en: The Spaniards started the colonization period which lasted for three centuries.
ny: Anthu a ku Spain anayamba nyengo ya atsamunda imene inatenga zaka mazana atatu.

en: Since the foundation of Asunción in 1537, Paraguay has managed to keep a lot of its indigenous character and identity.
ny: Kuyambira pamene mzinda wa Asunción unakhazikitsidwa mu 1537, dziko la Paraguay lakhala likusungabe makhalidwe ake ndi mmene anthu ake amaonekera.

en: Argentina is well known for having one of the best polo teams and players in the world.
ny: Argentina amadziwika kuti ali ndi timu yabwino kwambiri ya polo komanso osewera abwino kwambiri padziko lonse.

en: The largest tournament of the year takes place in December at the polo fields in Las Cañitas.
ny: Mpikisano waukulu kwambiri wa chaka umakhala mu December m'minda ya polo ku Las Cañitas.

en: Smaller tournaments and matches can also be seen here at other times of the year.
ny: Maseŵera aang'ono ndi machesi angawonekenso pano panthaŵi zina za chaka.

en: For news on tournaments and where to buy tickets for polo matches, check Asociacion Argentina de Polo.
ny: Kuti mudziwe zambiri zokhudza maseŵera a polo komanso kumene mungagule matikiti a maseŵera a polo, onani tsamba lakuti Asociacion Argentina de Polo.

en: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP).
ny: Ndalama ya boma ya Falkland ndi Falkland pound (FKP) yomwe mtengo wake umakhala wofanana ndi wa British pound imodzi (GBP).

en: Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store.
ny: Ndalama zingasinthidwe pa banki yokha pazilumbazi yomwe ili ku Stanley kutsogolo kwa sitolo ya FIC West.

en: British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted.
ny: Ndalama za ku Britain zimalandiridwa kulikonse m'zilumbazi ndipo mkati mwa makhadi a ngongole a Stanley ndi madola a United States nawonso amalandiridwa kaŵirikaŵiri.

en: On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method.
ny: Pazilumba zakutali, mwina anthu sadzalandira makadi a ngongole, ngakhale kuti ndalama za ku Britain ndi ku United States zingatengedwe; funsani eni ake pasadakhale kuti mudziŵe njira yoyenera yolipira.

en: It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.
ny: N'zosatheka kusinthanitsa ndalama za ku Falkland kunja kwa zilumbazi, choncho sinthanitsani ndalamazo musanachoke.

en: Since Montevideo is south of the Equator, it is summer there when it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere and vice versa.
ny: Popeza kuti Montevideo ili kum'mwera kwa dziko lapansi, kumeneku kuli chilimwe pamene kum'mwera kwa dziko lapansi kuli nyengo yozizira ndipo m'malo mwake kuli nyengo yozizira.

en: Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30°C are common.
ny: Montevideo ali m'madera otentha kwambiri; m'miyezi ya chilimwe, kutentha kwa pamwamba pa +30°C n'kofala.

en: The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says.
ny: M'nyengo yozizira, nyengo imakhala yozizira kwambiri: kutentha sikumafika pansi pa zero, koma mphepo ndi chinyezi zimagwirizanitsa kuti nyengoyo ikhale yozizira kuposa mmene thermometer imanenera.

en: There are no particular "rainy" and "dry" seasons: the amount of rain stays roughly the same throughout the year.
ny: Palibe nyengo ya "mvula" ndi "youma" yeniyeni: kuchuluka kwa mvula kumakhalabe kofanana chaka chonse.

en: Though many of the animals in the park are used to seeing humans, the wildlife is nonetheless wild and should not be fed or disturbed.
ny: Ngakhale kuti nyama zambiri za m'nkhalangoyi zimazoloŵera kuona anthu, nyama zakutchirezo n'zosaoneka ndipo siziyenera kudyetsedwa kapena kusokonezedwa.

en: According to park authorities, stay at least 100 yards/meters away from bears and wolves and 25 yards/meters from all other wild animals!
ny: Malinga ndi zimene akuluakulu a pakiyo amanena, muyenera kukhala patali ndi zimbalangondo ndi mimbulu pamtunda wa mamita 100 ndiponso nyama zina zonse zakutchire pamtunda wa mamita 25!

en: No matter how docile they may look, bison, elk, moose, bears, and nearly all large animals can attack.
ny: Ngakhale kuti amaoneka kuti ndi omvera, nyani, nyerere, nyerere, ndi pafupifupi nyama zonse zazikulu zimatha kuukira.

en: Each year, dozens of visitors are injured because they didn't keep a proper distance. These animals are large, wild, and potentially dangerous, so give them their space.
ny: Chaka chilichonse, alendo ambirimbiri amavulala chifukwa chosasunga mtunda woyenera. Nyama zimenezi ndi zazikulu, zakutchire, ndiponso zingathe kukhala zoopsa, choncho muzizipatsa malo.

en: In addition, be aware that odors attract bears and other wildlife, so avoid carrying or cooking odorous foods and keep a clean camp.
ny: Komanso, dziŵani kuti fungo limakopa zimbalangondo ndi nyama zina zakutchire, chotero peŵani kunyamula kapena kuphika zakudya zonunkha ndi kusunga msasa wanu woyera.

en: Apia is the capital of Samoa. The town is on the island of Upolu and has a population of just under 40,000.
ny: Apia ndi likulu la dziko la Samoa, ndipo lili pachilumba cha Upolu ndipo kuli anthu osachepera 40,000.

en: Apia was founded in the 1850s and has been the official capital of Samoa since 1959.
ny: Apia anakhazikitsidwa m'ma 1850 ndipo wakhala likulu la boma la Samoa kuyambira 1959.

en: The harbor was the site of an infamous naval standoff in 1889 when seven ships from Germany, the US, and Britain refused to leave the harbor.
ny: M'chaka cha 1889, sitima zapamadzi zokwana 7 zochokera ku Germany, ku United States ndi ku Britain zinakana kuchoka m'chitsimechi.

en: All the ships were sunk, except for one British cruiser. Nearly 200 American and German lives were lost.
ny: Zombo zonse zinamira, kupatulapo sitima imodzi ya nkhondo ya ku Britain.

en: During the struggle for independence organised by the Mau movement, a peaceful gathering in the town resulted in the killing of the paramount chief Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III.
ny: Panthaŵi ya nkhondo ya ufulu wa dziko yokonzedwa ndi gulu la Mau, msonkhano wamtendere m'tauniyo unachititsa kuti mkulu wa dziko la Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III aphedwe.

en: There are many beaches, due to Auckland's straddling of two harbours. The most popular ones are in three areas.
ny: M'derali muli magombe ambiri chifukwa chakuti mzinda wa Auckland uli ndi madoko awiri, ndipo pali madera atatu amene anthu ambiri amakonda.

en: North Shore beaches (in North Harbour district) are on the Pacific Ocean and stretch from Long Bay in the north to Devonport in the south.
ny: Magombe a North Shore (ku North Harbour district) ali pa Nyanja ya Pacific ndipo amachokera ku Long Bay kumpoto mpaka ku Devonport kumwera.

en: They are almost all sandy beaches with safe swimming, and most have shade provided by pohutukawa trees.
ny: Zambiri mwa magombewo ndi amchenga ndipo n'zotheka kusambira m'madzi, ndipo ambiri amakhala ndi mthunzi wa mitengo ya pohutukawa.

en: Tamaki Drive beaches are on the Waitemata Harbour, in the upmarket suburbs of Mission Bay and St Heliers in Central Auckland.
ny: Magombe a Tamaki Drive ali pa doko la Waitemata, m'madera a m'mphepete mwa mzinda wa Mission Bay ndi St Heliers ku Central Auckland.

en: These are sometimes-crowded family beaches with a good range of shops lining the shore. Swimming is safe.
ny: Magombe amenewa nthawi zina amakhala odzaza ndi anthu ndipo pali mashopu ambiri.

en: The main local beer is 'Number One', it is not a complex beer, but pleasant and refreshing. The other local beer is called "Manta".
ny: The chachikulu mowa m'deralo ndi 'Number Mmodzi', si zovuta mowa, koma zosangalatsa ndi zotsitsimula.

en: There are many French wines to be had, but the New Zealand and Australian wines might travel better.
ny: Pali vinyo wambiri wa ku France amene angadye, koma vinyo wa ku New Zealand ndi wa ku Australia angakhale abwino kwambiri.

en: The local tap water is perfectly safe to drink, but bottled water is easy to find if you are fearful.
ny: Madzi a m'chitsime a m'deralo ndi abwino kumwa, koma madzi a m'mabotolo ndi osavuta kupeza ngati mukuopa.

en: For Australians, the idea of 'flat white' coffee is foreign. A short black is 'espresso', cappuccino comes heaped high with cream (not froth), and tea is served without milk.
ny: Anthu a ku Australia sakonda khofi wa mtundu wa 'woyera' chifukwa khofi wa mtundu wa 'kuwala' ndi 'espresso,' cappuccino ndi kirimu (osati thovu), ndipo tiyi ndi khofi wopanda mkaka.

en: The hot chocolate is up to Belgian standards. Fruit juices are pricey but excellent.
ny: Chokoleti chotentha n'chokwanira ku Belgium ndipo madzi a zipatso ndi okwera mtengo koma abwino kwambiri.

en: Many trips to the reef are made all year around, and injuries due to any of these causes on the reef are rare.
ny: Anthu ambiri amapita kukaona matanthwewa chaka chonse, ndipo anthu ovulala chifukwa cha zimenezi amapezeka kawirikawiri.

en: Still, take advice from authorities, obey all signs, and pay close attention to safety warnings.
ny: Komabe, pemphani malangizo kwa akuluakulu a boma, mverani zizindikiro zonse, ndipo mvetserani kwambiri machenjezo a chitetezo.

en: Box jellyfish occur near beaches and near river estuaries from October to April north of 1770. They can occasionally be found outside these times.
ny: Nsomba zotchedwa box jellyfish zimapezeka pafupi ndi magombe ndi pafupi ndi mitsinje kuyambira mu October mpaka April kumpoto kwa 1770.

en: Sharks do exist, however they rarely attack humans. Most sharks are scared of humans and would swim away.
ny: N'zoona kuti nsombazi zimapezeka, koma nthawi zambiri sizigwera anthu.

en: Saltwater Crocodiles do not actively live in the ocean, their primary habitat is in river estuaries north from Rockhampton.
ny: Nkhonozi sizimachita zinthu zambiri m'nyanja, koma zimakhala m'mitsinje ya m'mphepete mwa mtsinje kumpoto kwa mzinda wa Rockhampton.

en: Booking in advance gives the traveller peace of mind that they will have somewhere to sleep once they arrive at their destination.
ny: Munthu akafuna kupita kumalo ena, ayenera kukonzekera kuti akafike kumene akupita, azidzakhala ndi malo ogona.

en: Travel agents often have deals with specific hotels, although you may find it possible to book other forms of accommodation, like camping grounds, through a travel agent.
ny: Makampani oyendayenda kaŵirikaŵiri amakhala ndi mapangano ndi mahotela enaake, ngakhale kuti mungapeze kuti n'zotheka kusungitsa malo ena ogona, monga malo omanga misasa, kudzera mwa kampani yoyendayenda.

en: Travel agents usually offer packages that include breakfast, transportation arrangements to/from the airport or even combined flight and hotel packages.
ny: Nthawi zambiri, mabungwe oyendayenda amapereka maulendo apadera monga chakudya cham'mawa, maulendo opita ku bwalo la ndege kapena maulendo apamtunda ndi a ku hotelo.

en: They can also hold the reservation for you if you need time to think about the offer or procure other documents for your destination (e.g. visa).
ny: Iwo angakusungireni malowo ngati mukufuna nthaŵi yoganizira za malowo kapena kupeza zikalata zina za komwe mukupita (mwachitsanzo, visa).

en: Any amendments or requests though should be coursed through the travel agent first and not directly with the hotel.
ny: Komabe, zosintha zilizonse kapena zopempha ziyenera kuperekedwa kwa wothandizila maulendo choyamba osati mwachindunji ku hotelo.

en: For some festivals, the vast majority of the attendants to music festivals decide to camp on site, and most attendants consider it a vital part of the experience.
ny: Pa zikondwerero zina, anthu ambiri amene amapita ku zikondwerero za nyimbo amasankha kukamanga msasa pamalowo, ndipo ambiri amaona kuti kuchita zimenezi n'kofunika kwambiri.

en: If you want to be close to the action you're going to have to get in early to get a camping site close to the music.
ny: Ngati mukufuna kukhala pafupi ndi zochitikazo muyenera kufika mwamsanga kuti mupeze malo okhala pafupi ndi nyimbo.

en: Remember that even though music on the main stages may have finished, there may be sections of the festival that will keep playing music until late into the night.
ny: Kumbukirani kuti ngakhale kuti nyimbo pa masiteji aakulu zingathe, pangakhale mbali zina za phwando zimene zidzapitiriza kuimba nyimbo mpaka usiku.

en: Some festivals have special camping areas for families with young children.
ny: Pa zikondwerero zina pamakhala malo apadera okhala ndi misasa ya mabanja okhala ndi ana aang'ono.

en: If crossing the Northern Baltic in winter, check the cabin location, as going through ice causes quite horrible noise for those most affected.
ny: Ngati mukudutsa Nyanja ya Baltic ya kumpoto m'nyengo yachisanu, onani malo a kanyumba, popeza kuti kudutsa m'zipale zozizira kumachititsa phokoso loipa kwambiri kwa anthu amene akuvutika kwambiri.

en: Saint Petersburg cruises include time in town. Cruise passengers are exempted from visa requirements (check the terms).
ny: Ulendo wa sitima zapamadzi wa St. Petersburg umaphatikizapo kukhala mumzindawu kwa nthawi yaitali.

en: Casinos typically make many efforts to maximize time and money spent by guests. Windows and clocks are usually absent, and exits can be hard to find.
ny: Makasino nthawi zambiri amayesetsa kuti alendo azigwiritsa ntchito bwino nthawi yawo komanso ndalama zawo.

en: They usually have special food, drink and entertainment offers, to keep guests in a good mood, and keep them at the premise.
ny: Nthaŵi zambiri amakhala ndi zakudya zapadera, zakumwa ndi zosangalatsa, kuti alendo akhale ndi maganizo abwino, ndi kuti akhalebe m'nyumba.

en: Some venues offer alcoholic beverages on the house. However, drunkenness impairs judgement, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.
ny: Komabe, kuledzera kumafooketsa luntha la kulingalira, ndipo oseŵera onse abwino amadziŵa kufunika kwa kukhala odzisunga.

en: Anyone who's going to drive at high latitudes or over mountain passes should consider the possibility of snow, ice, or freezing temperatures.
ny: Aliyense amene akuyendetsa galimoto pamtunda wautali kapena kudutsa mapiri ayenera kuganizira za kuthekera kwa chipale chofeŵa, ayezi, kapena kuzizira.

en: On icy and snowy roadways, friction is low and you cannot drive as if you were on bare asphalt.
ny: M'misewu ya chipale chofewa ndi ya ayezi, simungayende ngati kuti mukuyenda pa phula.

en: During blizzards, enough snow to get you stuck can fall in very little time.
ny: M'nyengo ya chipale chofewa, chipale chofeŵa chokwanira kukugwirani chingagwe m'nthaŵi yochepa kwambiri.

en: Visibility may also be restricted by falling or blowing snow or by condensation or ice on vehicle windows.
ny: Kuoneka kwa zinthu kungakhale kochepa chifukwa cha kugwa kapena kuphulika kwa chipale chofewa kapena chifukwa cha kuzizira kapena kuzizira kwa mawindo a galimoto.

en: On the other hand, icy and snowy conditions are normal in many countries, and traffic goes on mostly uninterrupted all year round.
ny: Komabe, m'mayiko ambiri, nyengo ya chipale chofeŵa ndi chipale chofeŵa ndi yofala, ndipo magalimoto amayenda mosadodometsedwa chaka chonse.

en: Safaris are perhaps the greatest tourism draw in Africa and the highlight for many visitors.
ny: Mwina maulendo a safari ndiwo amakopa alendo ambiri ku Africa ndipo ndi chinthu chochititsa chidwi kwambiri kwa alendo ambiri.

en: The term safari in popular use refers to overland travel to view the stunning African wildlife, particularly on savanna.
ny: Mawu akuti safari amene anthu ambiri amagwiritsa ntchito amanena za kuyenda panyanja kukaona nyama zakutchire zochititsa chidwi za ku Africa, makamaka ku savanna.

en: Some animals, such as elephants and giraffes, tend to approach closely to cars and standard equipment will allow good viewing.
ny: Nyama zina, monga njovu ndi anyani, zimayandikira kwambiri magalimoto ndipo zipangizo zoyenera zimalola kuona bwino.

en: Lions, cheetahs and leopards are sometimes shy and you will see them better with binoculars.
ny: Mikango, ma cheetah ndi nyalugwe nthaŵi zina amakhala amanyazi ndipo mudzaziona bwino ndi magalasi.

en: A walking safari (also called a "bush walk", "hiking safari", or going "footing") consists of hiking, either for a few hours or several days.
ny: Kuyenda ulendo wautali (womwe umatchedwanso "kuyenda m'nkhalango", "kuyenda ulendo wautali", kapena "kuyenda pansi") kumaphatikizapo kuyenda maulendo ataliatali, kaya kwa maola angapo kapena masiku angapo.

en: The Paralympics will take place from 24 August to 5 September 2021. Some events will be held in other locations throughout Japan.
ny: Masewera a Paralympics adzachitika kuyambira pa 24 Ogasiti mpaka 5 Seputembara 2021. Zochitika zina zichitika m'malo ena ku Japan.

en: Tokyo will be the only Asian city to have hosted two summer Olympics, having hosted the games in 1964.
ny: Tokyo idzakhala mzinda wokha wa ku Asia umene unachititsa maseŵera a Olimpiki a chilimwe aŵiri, popeza kuti unachititsa maseŵerawo mu 1964.

en: If you booked your flights and accommodation for 2020 before the postponement was announced, you may have a tricky situation.
ny: Ngati mwalembapo malo okhala ndi ndege za 2020 kusanachitike kusinthaku, mungakumane ndi vuto.

en: Cancellation policies vary, but as of late March most coronavirus-based cancellation policies don't extend to July 2020, when the Olympics had been scheduled.
ny: Malamulo oletsa masewerawa amasiyanasiyana, koma pofika kumapeto kwa mwezi wa March, malamulo ambiri oletsa masewerawa chifukwa cha matenda a coronavirus sanalipo mpaka mu July 2020, pamene maseŵera a Olimpiki anakonzedweratu.

en: It's expected that most event tickets will cost between ¥2,500 and ¥130,000, with typical tickets costing around ¥7,000.
ny: Anthu ambiri amayembekezera kuti matikiti a mwambowu adzagula pakati pa ¥2,500 ndi ¥130,000, ndipo matikiti ena amakhala pafupifupi ¥7,000.

en: Ironing damp clothes can help them dry. Many hotels have an iron and ironing board available for loan, even if one is not present in the room.
ny: Kuwombera zovala zonyowa kungawathandize kuti aziuma. mahotela ambiri ali ndi bolodi la kuwombera ndi kuwombera lomwe limapezeka kuti liperekedwe, ngakhale ngati palibe mmodzi amene ali m'chipindacho.

en: If an iron isn't available, or if you don't fancy wearing ironed socks, then you can try using a hairdryer, if available.
ny: Ngati simungathe kuvala nsapato zotayidwa, kapena ngati simukufuna kuvala masokosi otayidwa, ndiye kuti mungayese kugwiritsa ntchito choumitsira tsitsi, ngati chilipo.

en: Be careful not to allow fabric to become too hot (which can cause shrinkage, or in extreme cases, scorch).
ny: Samalani kuti nsalu isatenthe kwambiri (zomwe zingachititse kuti isagwe, kapena kuyaka kwambiri).

en: There are different ways of purifying water, some more effective against specific threats.
ny: Pali njira zosiyanasiyana zoyeretsera madzi, zina n'zothandiza kwambiri polimbana ndi zinthu zina zimene zingawononge madzi.

en: In some areas boiling water for a minute is enough, in others several minutes are needed.
ny: M'madera ena, madzi owiritsa kwa mphindi imodzi ndi okwanira, koma m'madera ena madzi owiritsa amafunika kwa mphindi zingapo.

en: Filters vary in effectiveness, and should you have a concern, then you should consider buying your water in a sealed bottle from a reputable company.
ny: Zosefera zimasiyana m'kuchita bwino, ndipo ngati muli ndi nkhaŵa, ndiye kuti muyenera kulingalira kugula madzi anu m'botolo losindikizidwa kuchokera ku kampani yolemekezeka.

en: Travellers may encounter animal pests that they are not familiar with in their home regions.
ny: Anthu amene akuyenda m'madera ena angakumane ndi tizilombo toyambitsa matenda tomwe sawadziwa.

en: Pests can spoil food, cause irritation, or in a worse case cause allergic reactions, spread venom, or transmit infections.
ny: Tizilombo toyambitsa matenda tingawononge chakudya, kuchipangitsa kuti chizivuta kudya, kapena ngati n'zoipa kwambiri, tingachititse kuti munthu akhale ndi vuto linalake, tizilombo toyambitsa matenda, kapena tizilombo toyambitsa matenda.

en: Infectious diseases themselves, or dangerous animals that can injure or kill people by force, do not usually qualify as pests.
ny: Matenda opatsirana okha, kapena nyama zoopsa zimene zingavulaze kapena kupha anthu mwachiwawa, kaŵirikaŵiri siziyenera kutchedwa tizilombo toyambitsa matenda.

en: Duty free shopping is the opportunity to buy goods exempted from taxes and excises at certain locations.
ny: Kugula zinthu popanda msonkho ndi mwayi wogula katundu womasulidwa ku misonkho ndi msonkho m'malo ena.

en: Travellers bound for countries with heavy taxation can sometimes save a considerable amount of money, especially on products such as alcoholic beverages and tobacco.
ny: Anthu amene amapita kumayiko amene kuli misonkho yambiri, nthawi zina amatha kusunga ndalama zambiri, makamaka pa zinthu monga zakumwa zoledzeretsa ndi fodya.

en: The stretch between Point Marion and Fairmont presents the most challenging driving conditions on the Buffalo-Pittsburgh Highway, passing frequently through isolated backwoods terrain.
ny: M'mbali ya msewu wa Point Marion ndi Fairmont, mumakhala mavuto aakulu kwambiri oyendetsa galimoto pamsewu wa Buffalo-Pittsburgh, chifukwa nthawi zambiri mumadutsa m'nkhalango.

en: If you're not used to driving on country roads, keep your wits about you: steep grades, narrow lanes, and sharp curves predominate.
ny: Ngati simumazoloŵera kuyendetsa galimoto pamsewu wa kumidzi, samalani: pali misewu yotalika, misewu yopapatiza, ndi malekezero ovuta.

en: Posted speed limits are noticeably lower than in previous and subsequent sections — commonly 35-40 mph (56-64 km/h) — and strict obedience to them is even more important than otherwise.
ny: Malire a liwiro amene amaikidwa ndi otsika kwambiri poyerekeza ndi a m'magawo am'mbuyomu ndi otsatira  kaŵirikaŵiri 35-40 mph (56-64 km/h)  ndipo kumvera kwawo mosamalitsa n'kofunika kwambiri kuposa zina.

en: Curiously, though, mobile phone service is much stronger here than along many other stretches of the route, e.g. the Pennsylvania Wilds.
ny: Komabe, n'zochititsa chidwi kuti telefoni ya m'manja ili ndi mphamvu kwambiri kuno kusiyana ndi mbali zina zambiri za msewuwo, mwachitsanzo, m'madera otchedwa Pennsylvania Wilds.

en: German pastries are quite good, and in Bavaria, are quite rich and varied, similar to those of their southern neighbor, Austria.
ny: Zakudya za ku Germany ndi zabwino kwambiri, ndipo ku Bavaria, ndi zolemera kwambiri ndiponso zosiyanasiyana, mofanana ndi za mnansi wawo wakumwera, Austria.

en: Fruit pastries are common, with apples cooked into pastries year round, and cherries and plums making their appearances during the summer.
ny: Zakudya zophika zipatso n'zofala, ndipo maapulo amaphikidwa chaka chonse, ndipo masika amapezeka ndi zipatso za chitumbuwa ndi tsabola.

en: Many German baked goods also feature almonds, hazelnuts, and other tree nuts. Popular cakes often pair particularly well with a cup of strong coffee.
ny: Zakudya zambiri za ku Germany zimaphatikizaponso mandimu, mtedza, ndi mtedza wina.

en: If you want some small though rich pastries, try what depending on region are called Berliner, Pfannkuchen or Krapfen.
ny: Ngati mukufuna zokometsera zazing'ono koma zolemera, yesani zomwe zimatchedwa Berliner, Pfannkuchen kapena Krapfen malinga ndi dera.

en: A curry is a dish based on herbs and spices, together with either meat or vegetables.
ny: Curry ndi mbale ya zitsamba ndi zonunkhira, pamodzi ndi nyama kapena ndiwo zamasamba.

en: A curry can be either "dry" or "wet" depending on the amount of liquid.
ny: Curry akhoza kukhala "youma" kapena "youma" malinga ndi kuchuluka kwa madzi.

en: In inland regions of Northern India and Pakistan, yogurt is commonly used in curries; in Southern India and some other coastal regions of the subcontinent, coconut milk is commonly used.
ny: M'madera akumidzi a kumpoto kwa India ndi Pakistan, yogurt imagwiritsidwa ntchito kwambiri popanga curry; Kum'mwera kwa India ndi madera ena a m'mphepete mwa nyanja a dzikoli, mkaka wa kokonati umagwiritsidwa ntchito kwambiri.

en: With 17,000 islands to choose from, Indonesian food is an umbrella term covering a vast variety of regional cuisines found across the nation.
ny: M'dzikoli muli zilumba zokwana 17,000 ndipo zakudya za ku Indonesia ndi za mitundu yosiyanasiyana.

en: But, if used without further qualifiers, the term tends to mean the food originally from the central and eastern parts of the main island Java.
ny: Koma, ngati agwiritsidwa ntchito popanda ziyeneretso zina, mawuwo amatanthauza chakudya chochokera ku mbali za pakati ndi kum'mawa kwa chilumba chachikulu cha Java.

en: Now widely available throughout the archipelago, Javanese cuisine features an array of simply seasoned dishes, the predominant flavorings the Javanese favor being peanuts, chillies, sugar (especially Javanese coconut sugar) and various aromatic spices.
ny: Tsopano chakudya cha ku Java chilipo m'zilumba zonse za ku Java ndipo chili ndi zakudya zosiyanasiyana zokhala ndi zokometsera. Zakudyazi ndi monga mtedza, chilli, shuga (makamaka shuga wa kokonati) ndi zonunkhira zosiyanasiyana.

en: Stirrups are supports for the rider's feet that hang down on either side of the saddle.
